Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Heather K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chateau on the Lake to attend a marriage conference. We only stayed 1 night there and then after the marriage conference was over got another hotel for the next night. The rooms were nice and clean and very big. Our room had an entry way and living room area and then a separate bedroom area. The Beds were not comfortable at all, and the walls must be really thin because we could hear the people next to us most of the night with a screaming child. Also we must have been right over where the delivery truck come because we could hear the beaping sounds of trucks backing up EARLY in the morning. Would not spend the extra money to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey in the land of cheap lodging.”
Reviews.Author: Christal D
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and to be fair to the hotel cheaper than other similarly rated hotels I've stayed at in other places. However in the land of $60 hotel rates that include breakfast this is out of place and geared toward the business traveler paying with an expense account. This hotel seems to specialize in conferences so I'm unsure if I would return to this resort for a family vacation. While I was there they hosted the Sextember conference. I'm not sure I want to explain those name tags to my kids!

Reviews.Title: “Chateau on the Lake”
Reviews.Author: Keith H
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice but expensive. Service for this level of hotel was ok. No breakfast added to price of stay. Movie theater was nice. I would say overall to expensive for what you get plus taxes to the room are very high. Next time would look for a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but balconies over air conditioning units useless”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaJB
Reviews.Content: We stayed Aug 16-19. Everything was fine BUT our room was above the air conditioning units. As previous comments, this makes the balconies unusable. Can't even have the sliding door open if it's nice. Too bad! I don't know what they can do about it but if you're paying full price, don't accept a room on that side. Room was clean but I don't think the bathroom floor had been wiped up. Same long hairs (I have short hair) there for at least two days. There was other stuff on the bathroom floor also, stuff that had been dropped, so I know it wasn't wiped up, floor must not be included in regular cleaning routine.

Reviews.Title: “I haven't even checked in yet, and I'm a little worried!”
Reviews.Author: Charity44881
Reviews.Content: I am about to take my first mini-vacation in several years, to celebrate a milestone birthday. I researched a LOT of establishments, and picked this one because of the stunning location and appearance. It looks to be one of the most fantastic choices within ready driving distance of me. I called this morning to make the reservation, because and I told the clerk that I was 1) taking my first vacation in a while, 2) celebrating a "big" birthday, and 3) looking for something "special". I asked her what she could recommend for me. This would have been a fantastic opportunity for her to ask about my interests, preferences, etc, and recommend (or customize) a special experience for me. Instead, she merely rattled off a list of facts about the property and then gave me a rate for a standard room. I asked if there were any rooms with a special view, etc, and ultimately selected a Lakefront King for something like $230/night. This wasn't too worrisome, but I went online when I had a moment, and started looking around at the property/amenities. Turns out, the hotel offers several packages that would have made my stay MUCH more special, including one with champagne, strawberries, a $50.00 food credit, valet parking, etc.... and this package went for only $250.00! The reservationist should absolutely have "upsold" me on this package. I called back to request an immediate change, and the same reservationist accommodated me. While I was speaking with her, I nicely stated that a "special" package was EXACTLY what I was seeking, and asked her if there were any other packages that I should be aware of. I was also interested in staying another night, potentially, if I could be accommodated in the room type I was seeking. Again, she didn't ask me what was important to me, didn't try to devise something that would interest me, and merely said that if I were wanting something special, then she would make the change to the room package reservation. Is it weird that I am already disappointed that the reservationist had the opportunity to "sell" me and excite me about something, and she passed it by twice? Am I to expect the same disinterested, lackluster action from the rest of the staff when I arrive? I'm spending good money for a few days away, and was planning to spend even more on spa services... I hope I am not disappointed. I want this to be a fabulous birthday getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Chateau Spa”
Reviews.Author: ColesDad1
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the Resort (we need more room so we rent a condo down the road) but I took my wife and son for a day at the spa.What a relaxing day.We all had massages and my wife had a wrap and some other treatments.We were treated like royality!We also enjoyed both the indoor and outdoor hot tubs.You must not miss this treat next time you are in branson.We'll be back at Christmas and maybe sooner if my schedule will afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: crm502
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three day weekend and really enjoyed ourselves. The staff was very nice, the rooms were really clean and the beds were comfortable. We arrived early and the staff was able to get us into our room several hours before the check in time. The outdoor pool was also very nice and had a great view of the lake. There is also an indoor pool as well. We ate the breakfast buffet on Saturday morning and everything was delicious. There is also a sweet shop on property with ice cream, cakes and cookies. We had a cinnamon roll for breakfast which was huge. Just a warning the dining at the Chateau was pretty expensive so you may consider eating off the property. The only negative is the long walk from any parking to the entrance of the property. I recommend the parking garage if you do not want to walk up the hill to the entrance of the property. There is also a marina with boat and jet ski rentals as well as canoes and kayaks for use. This is my second stay at this property and i would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying more than one night”
Reviews.Author: Ravennj
Reviews.Content: It was a wilderness like stay that felt luxurious which appealed to both of us. We only had time to stay one night but we arrived too late that evening to fully enjoy all the features of the hotel. Great bathroom and extra sink area out in the main bedroom area too. The bar/lounge was so elegent yet relaxing, wrap around deck to watch an incoming storm had dozen's of people gathered, rocking in their rockers enjoying the night show and watching the lake light up with all the lightening. The pools (indoor & outdoor) both looked fabulous but we didn't get a chance to go in. We did use the complimentary Canoe & take a stoll across the lake the next afternoon after enjoying the great breakfast buffet overlooking the indoor stream and watching the birds in their large cages. Its really hard to tell when you're indoors, they did a great job with the public areas and the rooms that we can't wait to go back again for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Four nice days”
Reviews.Author: Pack_Riley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 8/12-8/16. As most posts here state it is a very nice property. We found the staff to be universally professional, friendly and helpful. The "extras" like "The Sweet Shoppe" is a plus, indoor and outdoor pools very nice, our room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We kayaked and rented a pontoon boat for a couple of hours to motor around the lake - very nice marina with great staff (thanks Andrew we enjoyed talking with you and your expertise with the pontoon boat). A few things I found disappointing for such a highly rated hotel were: 1) very lame coffee service in the room and no free coffee in the lobby area. We are happy to brew our own in the room but only a one-cup coffee maker with the pre-measured single cup packets were available - ugh; 2) our room - which overlooked the pool - was on the south side of the building above the VERY loud HVAC power "plant". The noise never stopped and it was impossible for us to have our sliders open because of the incessant noise. Ask for a room on the north side of the building to avoid this; 3) while I know this is billed as a high end hotel and spa, I found the spa prices to be absolutely appalling. I live in the Chicago area and have frequented high end spas here and have never paid the prices quoted at this Spa ($95 for a 50 min. massage PLUS a mandatory 20% service fee???? Really??? Why not just say the massage is $115?) I was not inclined to pay those prices so I did not use the spa although I had been looking forward to doing so during our stay; 4) This may be a very small issue but the pool side menu and the "Yesterday's" deli menus need to offer more vegetarian options - there are hardly any at all making grabbing a bite to eat at or near the pool difficult for a non meat eater; 5) I appreciated that Chateau has a fitness center but it is outdated. Neither the treadmills nor the cross trainers have individual TV screens and the treadmills have very few updated features I have found at most hotels - even places like Holiday Inn Express. All in all I DO recommend Chateau. Aside from a few small annoyances it was a great stay and we would stay here again. We enjoyed all the outdoor activities available either on the property or close by. BTW, Katherine at the concierge desk was very, very helpful, professional and friendly. Thanks to Chateau for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Brunch is Incredible!!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa A
Reviews.Content: Our extended family stays at the Chateau whenever we meet in Branson. The hotel is very deserving of its four star rating. It is a full service, luxury hotel, with just about everything you could want or need. Extra perks include an ice cream shop, movie theater, spa services, shopping boutiques, pools ( indoor and out), tennis courts, marina, convention meeting rooms, playground, and restaurant. Anyone can come eat at the restaurant, not just hotel guests. The brunches on the weekends are scrumptious and have a wide variety of delicious foods to choose from. Cheesy grits are heavenly!!! All of the fruit is very fresh. Omelets are made to order. If the weather is nice, you can sit out on the veranda while you eat. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Each time is a different experience”
Reviews.Author: mzzlol
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Rooms are spacious, clean and gorgeous. Beds are very comfy, with temp control in each room. Huge bathroom that are up to date, and great decor. Now, the service very interesting! We just spent the weekend here. Housekeeping knocked on our door at 830 am Saturday morning? Really after a night of drinks, that was a tad bit early. Then again at 930am we were asked to sign a log that is was ok not to clean our room! That was a first ever! Last year this same time, my friend had two rooms. One which was paid for friends that were coming later was given to another guest! After asking the night person what was going to be done she was told the rooms are all filled. There was nothing that could be done. Amazing, no apology no options not even comped for another time. So sadly this is our last stay we have been here every year for 5 years. Hopefully you can stay without any incidents, the first 3 years were great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Stan P
Reviews.Content: Very nice property. The young lady at the from desk was very pleasant and quite helpful in giving me directions and helping me with a gift card I had for one of the gift shops. Food was very good and very filling. Nice large TV. Rooms are quite large and very well designed. Great views of the lake. Rooms are vey quiet. Very enjoyable stay. Branson is not my favorite place to visit but the group I was with love the place - its just not my thing. This property made my visit relaxing and is the only place I will stay when I am forced to come to Branson LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: teslastones
Reviews.Content: The only downside was the parking is a little far from the hotel proper. This is , no doubt, due to the terrain Our experience was very good overall We would stay there again The setting results in beautiful views in all directions The water feature both inside and out is very nice

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay but not Great.”
Reviews.Author: kanmac
Reviews.Content: Our check in experience was mediocre at best. Only on person working check in with the other talking to another employee. Ice machine on our floor did not work until our final day. On the second morning a group of us were scheduled to leave for golf at 6:45 am. When we arrived in the lobby we found no bell service to retrieve golf clubs or valet parked vehicles. One night manager was trying to do it all. We could not even get a cup of coffee as nothing was open. On the positive side the rooms were very spacious and well appointed. The food served in conjunction with our convention was quite good and plentiful. Concierge service was very helpful with directions etc. All in all an ok stay but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: TravelBasehor_KS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and had a wonderful time, the view of the lake was so beautiful. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating, great service in the restaurants, front desk and bar. I felt like a queen at this hotel, very nice. I do agree with the other comments on the price of the food, it was very high but oh so good. I guess you do get what you pay for. All the meals were great, we had a wonderful Sunday Brunch with Mimosas included, yum good food. The only bad thing was the bed and pillows were very hard. We tried to switch rooms but they said all the beds were the same. I did get softer pillows brought up that helped a little.

Reviews.Title: “It´s Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jair R
Reviews.Content: I went for business, and I really had a lot of free time, and there´s nothing else to do in Branson. I went there in august and I felt like in a ghost town. Almost all the attraction (the good ones) was closed during week days. The Night life is poor. If you will stay at the chateau, you will need a car, cause is not close where the action is. The room was beautyful and clean, nice view to the lake. The convention center facilities are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Families”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia D
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel was just about empty. Everything about the hotel was just about average with the exception of the presentation of the building as you pull up and the indoor "creek" was quite pretty. Our room had a small balcony overlooking air conditioning units. No furniture on the balcony, but it had a lousy view and was too loud to sit out there anyway. The power lines ruined the best view they had from the pool outside. We did not try the food because it was too pricy and were afraid with it being so desolate, it may not be fresh. The people looked surprised when we checked out at 4 in the evening (since the night was already paid for), but we found accommodations at Big Cedar and headed out in hopes of enjoying the remainder of our vacation. It strikes me of more of a convention hotel than a vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debrap p
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 24th year anniversary at the Chateau. It was amazing. We enjoyed the beautiful view of the lake from our room. We also enjoyed the onsite theater. The grille had a great selection of everything you can imagine on the breakfast buffet,bacon,eggs, potatoes, fruit, Danishes ect... The rooms were very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The pool was clean and lots of fun. The staff treated us like royalty. We are planning our next trip to the Chateau. Thanks Chateau on the lake for making our anniversary one to remember for years to come!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best 4th of July!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: First time to Branson, was unsure where to see the fireworks, could not find much information on it at all!!!!! So, decided to book a night at the Chateau on the Lakes.. we were able to see the fireworks poolside... it was beautiful... we could order drinks and food right at the pool.. kids loved it. They had a barbeque and music in the tent next to pool area that was extra but we didn't feel the need to join at all, there was not too many people at the pool are so it was perfect for our kids to swim and enjoy the view.... Hotel was nice clean and big...lots to see... everyone very nice... we were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “It's all it should be for a luxury get away”
Reviews.Author: TRIPDIVER
Reviews.Content: From the arrival at the front door, to the late night at the Library bar, it offers class and yet a relaxed luxury. The piano player is very good entertainment while enjoying the food that is just the right mix of comfort food to satisfy the appitite and yet meet the next level of fine dining. We enjoyed the inside patio (great views with water falls) for light fare and the breaffast on the landing overlooking the lake and pool. It has it all. Some might say a little expensive, especially for drinks at the pool. For my money it delivers a clean, well serviced and exiting place to feel you have gone some where special while at the lake or taking in the branson entertainment. Check it out. We had a great time on two seperate visits.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing retreat”
Reviews.Author: Stacey S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 5 nights at Chateua on the Lake. I admit I was not exctied about a trip to Branson as I prefer my get-away on the quiet side, indlgent side. This hotel was PERFECT. It is far enough outside the main drag as to feel remote but we were still able to easily get to anything we might want to see (which was very litte in our case). The room was spacious and comfortable, though the tubs are just standard sized. Our balcony over-looking the lake was small but gave us a lovely view of the sunset and the hotel's fireworks.Though it was over 100 degrees, the relaxing by the pool was comfortable with cold towels delivered by friendly staff. We also enjoyed using the canoes and the beautiful spa. All in all far more than I expected in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best.”
Reviews.Author: chef31
Reviews.Content: Everytime we stay at the Chateau, we have a great time. The staff is excellent and very friendly. We enjoyed the valet parking and had a pleasant conversation with the valet every time we passed through. Check-in was quick and easy even though several people were arriving at the same time. This hotel is well planned and has a great lay-out. Everything is close by and it doesn't take long to find your way around. Our room was near the elevator and still was quiet. The room had a king bed and a sleeper sofa. The bed was slightly firmer than I prefer, yet I slept well every night. One nice feature was the extra sink in the room. The bathroom was spacious and well appointed and featured a hamper and a TV speaker with volume control. Everything was very clean. We had a beautiful view of the pool and Table Rock Lake from our small balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed being by the Lake”
Reviews.Author: DanPlubell
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Be prepared for high priced food and internet connection. I don't mind paying for internet connection; if it is a good connection. The internet connection is rather slow. And, you have to pay for each device. The room we had didn't have a refrigerator. We enjoyed being away from the main part of Branson. The view of the lake is great from the lakeside rooms. The staff was very helpful and the service was good. The marina is well maintained and it was easy to launch and retrieve our boat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on Table Rock Lake”
Reviews.Author: Iowa_Power_Guy
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at the Chateau on the lake while attending a conference in Branson, MO. This was our first stay and it was a nice hotel with a very friendly staff. The view of Table Rock lake was excellent from our room and our room was a nice two room suite. My bed was comfortable and the AC worked well, always important to me, if these are wrong, nothing else seems to matter. The hotel was quiet, lots of families but no noises in the middle of the night. It was definitely a peaceful nights sleep. My wife enjoyed the hotel amenities (gift shop, deli, sweet shop, movie theater) while I was at the conference. We also had ice cream at the on-site ice cream parlor one night and it was nice, the caffe mocha was good as well. Wife ate at the deli and enjoyed her lunch, she noted it was a little on the expensive side. The hotel is clean, well decorated and is truly a beautiful property. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is impressive when you see it up on the hill as you are driving across the dam at Table Rock lake. I must agree with others that have reviewed this hotel, it is over priced. I was a bit shocked when I got the bill under the door. I would have given it 5-stars if the price would have been more in line with what I would expect in the mid-west. If you are wanting to spend time at the lake and not be too close to the hustle and bustle of Branson, and you don't mind spending a few extra dollars, Chateau at the Lake is the perfect hotel. It takes about 20 minutes to get from the Chateau to Branson Landing. We stayed at the Hilton at Branson Landing last year and would rank it above Chateau at the Lake if you are trying to choose between two of the nicest hotels in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: Stiouxee
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Chateua. Our room wasn't ready when we checked in, so we did have to wait about 30 minutes. The room was very nice and very spacious. If you are watching TV and need to use the bathroom, don't worry you won't miss anything. There are tv speakers in the bathroom so you can still hear your show. That was a first! Overall, I think The Chateau is overpriced for what you get. We did have an awesome view of the lake with a small balcony on our room. The room was clean. There is no refrigerator in the rooms, no free breakfast and no free wifi except in the lobby. So, you are really just paying for the room and the "prettiness" of the place. That being said, it is a beautiful hotel. They have a movie theater in the basement with free popcorn. The pool and other facilities are nice. We did not try the restaurant or look in any of the shops while we were there. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay, but glad we had a group discount and did not pay full price as we don't think it would be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort for Branson with Beautiful lake views.”
Reviews.Author: kit628
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business conference for four days in June. If you are used to places like the Hampton Inn, the resort will please you. If you are searching for more modern decor within walking distance of restaurants/shopping then I would stay at the Hilton at Branson Landing. We didn't eat at the restaurants except for the small cafe on the first level. Our breakfast and dinner was provided for our conference in the meeting rooms. The eggs were so rubbery and fake and the coffee was the worst I've had at resorts like this. This resort will be very dated in a few years. Here are the major pros/cons: Pros: 1. Beautiful lake view and grounds were excellent. 2. Private marina to rent boats . They also have kayaks and paddle boats for free to guests. The Boat House on the marina had some good quality Table Rock lake apparel if you want to pick up a t-shirt. 3. Service was good. We had no complaints and there were plenty of people around to help you. Cons: 1. Beds were uncomfortable, even my 10 year old complained. The pillows were hard and lumpy. This is Hugely important to get a good nights sleep, especially b/ c this was a work-related trip. 2. Be ware of the balconies if you have one. Two of my co-workers were locked out of their room when they stepped out to see the view. One of the co- workers two daughters were stuck out on the balcony for 4 hours. The door lock sticks when you shut it so beware. 3. Tap water was terrible- Complimentary bottles of water would have been nice, especially not having a mini fridge. 4. No exhaust fan in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in Branson”
Reviews.Author: HopeTravelot
Reviews.Content: The view! If you are not staying there then go get a glass of wine at the bar and just sit and watch the sunset. If you don't think its one of the best things you have done in Branson, then ignore all my reviews... we are very different people... The room was beautiful and I was so relaxed on my vacation walking around the beautiful hotel. The breakfast was nice and a perfect start to my day. Its more relaxing than being in the hustle and bustle of the Branson strip and downtown Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Niiiice”
Reviews.Author: djphilgood
Reviews.Content: This was everything that i could of asked for. Nice people, nice scenery. it was to die for. I most definitely will be back here again!! the food was expensive. but i expected that. pull is 24hours. they also had a movie theater. mainly showed kids movies but they still had one.

Reviews.Title: “28th anniversary trip and disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: trippinalil
Reviews.Content: Booked what we thought was a great deal through Travelzoo and found out while we were there that it was pretty much the going rate and still expensive for what we got and how we were initially treated. We upgraded to a King suite with the deal but it was supposed to be a view off of the front of the hotel which had a lake and dam view just not the full lake view you pay a little extra for. We booked for the Sunday and Monday at the end of the Memorial day weekend and and did the confirmation call and confirmed that we had a balcony room. We were driving through Branson several weeks before our booking and decided to see the hotel where we would be staying so we stopped and asked to see a room like we would be staying in and they told us it would not be possible. They did confirm though that we had a balcony room on the front of the hotel. When we arrived for our visit our luggage was in disarray because we had to rummage around in it to find a couple of things on our trip and a few things were scattered in the vehicle. We did not want the bell person to have to wait around on us so we requested that we could get a luggage cart so we could get our things in order and we would just do it in our own time. It was a pain when the doorman brought the cart over and wouldn't leave. We felt like we were rushed with him breathing down our backs. It was embarassing being there and our things not ready and his head poking in trying to get whatever he could. We wanted a private moment to get things together and it was not private at all. I didn't know it but he shadowed my wife to the room with the cart and she did not have cash on her for a tip while I parked the truck. I had to park in the parking garage and back in so that I had the kayak pinned against the wall and the cap down so it was difficult for it to be stolen. I was hoping that the security gates on the garage were working but one was missing totally. When my wife got to the room she found a brown recluse spider on the lamp shade when she went to turn the light on. I was not going to mess with it soshe called 4 star hotel. It took 15 minutes for somebody to get rid of it. We were wanting to leave to go eat and it seemed like an eternity. The room was not on the front of the hotel it was lakefront, but there was no balcony just half windows and we noticed that there were pets everywhere on the floor. Then we found out that there were fireworks that night off the front of the hotel for Memorial day so I guess we had been moved to the pet floor to accomodate somebody booking for the fireworks. The lights from the pool obscured the lake view at night on the 3rd floor. Don't drink the bottle of water on the counter that looks complimentary that other hotels do. It is $3 The carpet looks faded and the bed felt soft and comfortable to begin with but it soon felt lumpy, but I am a sensitive sleeper. The linens did feel nice but the pillows flattened with the weight of your arm. The next day when I decided to go to the desk and say something about what room we recieved they did change rooms without a hassle. I should never have had to say anything. If they had documented that I came to check out my room they should have known I would say something. when it wasn't what I had booked. The upgrade was not an upgrade. I do not want to be walking around after somebody elses pets when I do not have one. I love animals but not staying after them on my anniversary trip. Our room was long and narrow and felt crowded all the time we were there. We felt like we had to get out not to be crowded. The atriums and restaraunts were beautiful but the prices for the food were outrageous. --- like around $5 for a bagel and on up. The staff is nice but not welcoming like most of the ozarks are. Try to walk from your car and stop at the pool with a soft drink cup and you will be scolded. They will bring you ice water which is nice or you will pay for thier drinks which are very high. If you have a soda you had in your room you cannot bring it to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not a "Four Star Resort"”
Reviews.Author: WC G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to take a short vacation and decided to stay at the Chateau. To summarize our stay I wanted to list the positives and negatives of our vacation. POSITIVES: • Check in process was painless (however, we had to pay an extra $50 just to check in early). • Concierge, very pleasant and professional. Getting all of the show tickets we wanted. • Surrounding grounds are just beautiful and very well kept. • We ate dinner at the grille, food was expensive, but very good as well as the excellent service. • Our room was a Lake Front Ambassador King Suite overlooking the lake....view was worth a million dollars. • Car parking valet was attentive and always on duty. NEGATIVES: • Room was not very clean, my expectations for a four star resort would be much better than what we experienced. Housekeeping manager needs to do a better job in checking out rooms. • Spoke with a housekeeping lady and she indicated that they clean from 13-15 rooms a day...not bad, but would have expected a better job. • Decor was old and dated. • Most of the time we had to keep the sliding door closed because of the calypso music being played at the pool was non-stop and also very loud. • Also regarding the calypso music, I had to call the front desk at 11PM to request that they please shut it down, particularly if you want to have the door open at night to sleep. • The area overlooking the pool, was very dirty, the ceilings had cob webs and a wasp nest. Some of the lights had two inches of dead bugs in them and were also extremely dirty. In summary, I feel that this is a three and a half star resort with the "possibility" of being a four star again.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NRL11_11_11
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I just stayed at this hotel. It is top notch. The breakfast buffet at the Chateau Grille was exceptional. There was a wonderful omelet and waffle chef. Our only recommendation would be to have couples only on some floors, so they won't be subject to screaming children running up and down the hallways. The only reason we did not rate this hotel excellent was due to lack of noise insulation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: ShellyMaranaAZ
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the resort, but wanted to try out the restaurant for lunch. We only had about an hour and a half before we had to be somewhere so we thought we would have a nice lunch at the Grille outside which overlooked the pool area and the lake. The hostess sat us at a table towards the back of the patio which was fine, but wanted more of a view. Our waitress came over and took our drink order and then left to attend to other tables. After about 10 minutes we caught her attention and informed her we were ready to order. She took our order and since we were having an early dinner my husband and I decided to split a sandwich. There is a $5 split fee which I thought was a little ridiculous considering the sandwich was $15. We ended up moving 3 tables over to have a better view which the staff didn't really seem like they wanted us to move. After 20 minutes of sitting there with only water, we realized we hadn't even received our drinks. I ordered a rootbeer and my husband ordered Ice tea. Nothing crazy. I got the busser to find our waitress and informed her of what was going on. We had not received our drinks or our salad and soup. She said that the kitchen was having issues and the drinks must of gotten lost along the way. We gave her 10 more minutes to bring us our drinks and nothing!!!! We got up and left. For as nice as the resort looks, they should have better wait staff! I was very disappointed. The only good thing about the entire place was the view.

Reviews.Title: “Retention of the status”
Reviews.Author: anne S
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for the first time for two nights in a room overlooking the mountains. However, it really overlooked the top of the parking garage or convention center. Lobby: Can we not have real flowers in a beautiful setting in the lobby area???? Plastic ones?????? Expected real. The room: Nothing special. Really no complaints, bed was nice, however, the TV control was confusing...Was nice to have a large countertop in the bathroom and the extra counter in the room was nice as well. Couldn't open our curtains at night because a spotlight on the garage (?) roof was glaring right at us! Was great to have 3 elevators in the hotel. Never had to wait! The pool: Disaster! Too many people and not enough lounge chairs. Attendants need to make sure people are actually using the lounge chairs and not just leaving stuff there. Need more lounge chairs. Also the cushions on the chairs are in desperate need of trashing. Most that I saw were ripped at corners. Really?????? I expected better! Also, need more places to sit and eat down there if you are going to offer food. Get rid of the grass space and put more loungers. I actually saw people trying to put their towels on the very small green grass and lay down???!!! Yikes! Was nice to have pool attendants walking around with water, but they could go around and pick up empty water cups that were left by poolside. They seemed to enjoy just talking to one another. (Where is the manager on this?) I read on website that the pool also offered cold towels, but didn't get offered any of those. Would have been nice at 90+ degrees!!! Could use a kid pool. Adult couples need to realize that there are a lot of kids running around this resort. When I looked in the outdoor hot tub, it was filled with pre-teen boys. The view from the pool area of the lake could be fabulous, but old mature landscaping has grown too tall. (Pool was important to us...They missed the mark for us on this! Since we couldn't find a spot at the pool and kids were running rampant, we went to marina to get a kayak. ) The food: Didn't eat in the Grille, but did have dinner and lunch in the Atrium Cafe. Food was excellent. Service was great. However, wanted to sit at a certain table at lunch, but was told that since they had a party of 7 in that area, we needed to sit somewhere else. Really? We refused that suggestion, and was seated where we wanted and had no problem with service. We were waited on and served quickly. Keep in mind, there was no one else in that area either. Didn't quite get all that!!! Ice cream bar and dessert area was fabulous. It was so nice to have that available during the evening. Marina: Not really that convenient. Need to drive there or wait for a shuttle. We choose to drive. One disappointment there is that you cannot swim or float around in the coves near the marina, even though it seems clear of any boating activity. We have stayed at other Table Rock places, where they have inner tubes and such that you can enjoy the water around the marina. We went out in a kayak and had a great time. Marina service was very good. No complaints, except for the fact that you offer men's swimwear, but have no women's swimwear. Why? Overall: Was a nice place. Staff was extremely friendly. Enjoyed the stay. Just hope that this review can offer everyone some insight to what we experienced. Would have been nice to be able to sit outside during eating at the restaurant or outside from the bar and not have to look and hear the pool. Bear in mind that if you sit outside at the Grille, you will be hearing all of the sounds of the kids at the pool. Need to build a new family pool off to the side of the hotel, out of the range of dining and lake viewing. Will we be back? Not sure. Chateau seems to be catering more to families, so if you are a couple looking for a romantic setting, this is probably not your place, in my opinion. If you enjoy watching a kids movie by the pool at 8 pm on a Saturday night, this place may be for you! Didn't expect that since they have an indoor movie theater set up just for kids. Pruning and mulching of the grounds should be a priority. The grounds original design is beautiful, but could look even better with proper maintaining.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Crazy”
Reviews.Author: Becky S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on New Years night and celebrated with he hotels band The Beatles, it was so much fun! The Hotel was decorated to a t, it was beautiful! our room was accomodating and clean. The Hotel is quite grandure, and not a bad price for the accomodations. Friendly employees. The Spa is what we come for at least three times a year! I haven't found a better more relaxing one yet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCKC
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel and was very impressed. I believe it's over 10 years old, but it feels like new throughout. My room had a partial oceanview room. The full view would be worth the extra expense if you plan on spending time on the balcony or like to wake up and have a great view of the lake out your window. My room had a separate vanity, nice flat screen, very large bathroom with a tub/shower combo and large countertop. Everything in rooms and the entire hotel for that matter, is of high quality. There are a lot of "nice touches" not found in every hotel like a hamper in the bathroom for you towels, etc. The hotel is just the right size. Big enough to have all the amenities including a spa, couple of restaurants, nice bar, deli/pastry shop, indoor and outdoor pool, fitness center and more, but it's very easy to navigate. The indoor pool and whirlpool are open 24 hours which is a really nice feature. My only recommendation would be to add free weights to the fitness center. I've never seen a decent sized fitness center that didn't have a set of free weights to use. You enter all the rooms from the interior which is beautiful and features a waterfall, lots of plants and some tropical birds. There are 3 elevators so you never have to wait for one. They also have a full service marina that offers everything from jet skis to full size boat rentals. The service I experienced was excellent as well. While kids are obviously allowed, I think this is the perfect place for a couple or a group of couples looking for a luxurious romantic spot. I would highly recommend this hotel. It might be a little pricey on the food and beverage, but you can always head into Branson which is about 15 minutes for any type of food you might like.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you value your sleep”
Reviews.Author: mimta
Reviews.Content: First of I have to complain about their beds they were horrible. They were so uncomfortable and hard to sleep on. The same goes for the pillows. We stayed there for two nights and let me tell you I was so sleep deprived along with my mom and sister. I would never ever stay here again. It was absolutely not worth the monies we paid. And keep in mind we had a Deluxe Room. Everything in the hotel was so overpriced from bottle of water to coffee. Please know that you get one refill for your coffee which we were not told until the second day. Just keep the coffee cup. The hotel has one pool which is not enough for such a big resort. There is one inside pool, moderate size, with a heated Jacuzzi that seemed to be filled with buckets of chlorine. We could not stay in the Jacuzzi for long since the smell of chlorine would hurt our eyes to the point that we would start tearing up. The inside pool was so cold and not heated, however the outside pool was heated which makes no sense. The outside pool was also dirty, and you could see that it was not regularly being cleaned. We could also not use the kayaks and paddle boats which was another disappointment. You could also hear bird sounds throughout the hotel which were really annoying, guests come to a hotel to get some piece and quiet and not to listen to birds all they long. Our room was spacious with two double beds. It had a sink next to one of the beds and then there was a bathroom with another sink and a stand up shower. The grounds of the resort are very nice and are kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “We Come Back Every Year”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to the Chateau each summer for many years. My husband and I came as a couple before having children, and we now bring our boys along. There are so many activities in the area (Branson) but we often simply stay put enjoying the pool, spa and views. The rooms are lovely and always very, very clean. We've never had one complaint about service, either. We rent a boat from the marina each time, and have had excellent experiences every time. I can't say enough about the Chateau...we'll keep staying!

Reviews.Title: “This isn't Branson”
Reviews.Author: ljgok
Reviews.Content: A lovely lodge themed hotel with stunning lake views more reminiscent of a resort in Vail or BC. The service level is very high, the Chateau Grille a pretty venue with fine food and service. this is certainly a contrast to the usual traffic chocked in Branson proper hotel but still with easy 10 minute access to all of the activities in Branson. Complementary paddle boat and kayak use at the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisR00
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. We have stayed here before and will again. Comfortable beds and quiet rooms. The views are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: bethers210
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful place and great staff...left with some great connections

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: ss0404
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with top-notch service and staff. You will pay for it, but if you want to avoid the touristy hotels of Branson, this is a beautiful place to stay and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: traveling m
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the chateau on the Lake. We have always stayed at the Hilton several times a year. We decided to try the Chateau.....WE LOVED IT!!! We will continue to stay at the Chateau from now on!! Beautiful resort, the staff made you feel like royalty! The bell men opened the doors for you and were very friendly!! The Chateau is VERY kid friendly!! We loved that they had so many activities going on for the kids!!! Loved the glass elevators and how beautiful the resort was from the inside and out. Staff was beyond friendly, and was very impressed on how the Hotel was very up on safety for their customers! Rooms were clean and very nice. It was like a dream come true!! We will being staying here from now on!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: bmtpep
Reviews.Content: When staying at the Chateau On The Lake last weekend our family could not have been more impressed! When we arrived it started with the door man and bell staff - so nice and were on top of making check in with kids something I could manage! Then the front desk - I felt like Royalty - they were all smiling as I looked around and listened to my needs as I am someone particular when it comes to our accomodations! Check in was just the beginnning - EVERY time we passed the front desk and went in and out of the hotel - my husband and I were greeted BY NAME - could not believe it - I travel for a living and this is usually the service you get when you stay every week at the same hotel - the Chateau felt like home - room was perfect - cleanliness was great but by far the front desk and bell staff made this a MEMORABLE stay - we will be back and will not stay at another place when visiting Branson!

Reviews.Title: “First time to Branson - Awesome views!!”
Reviews.Author: okietravel918
Reviews.Content: First time to Branson, stayed at Chateau on the Lake. It's about 10 minutes past the main strip of Branson activities but it's worth the drive for the gorgeous views and lovely relaxing hotel. For the price and service level of the hotel, I did expect to have a mini fridge (empty or stocked) but our room type (king lakeview) did not have one. We took advantage of the great weather and hotel bar and had a glass of wine out on the deck. So lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the middle of Missouri!”
Reviews.Author: brucebush
Reviews.Content: We checked in late last night and had room service It was fantastic it's like they bring a five star restaurant to your room. These people know what service is and means ! The weather was perfect and we are spending the day on the pool deck for in the morning we drive back to Tulsa to start are busy season at work . We can't wait to come back for Easter brunch. Are 9 year old told me today dad I think this is the "good life"! I agree

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but seemed dark overall”
Reviews.Author: misand
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room at the hotel which was very nice, it was a double suite. The bedroom had a window in it and so did the living room, but somehow the room still seemed dark. I imagine it was just on the wrong side of the building for sunlight. We were there for a conference. The location of the property was a bit out of the way. It had a great view though. If you are going for rest and relaxation this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Kansas-traveler13
Reviews.Content: Stayed last weekend and was disappointed over some details. Room 413 was very noisy...too close to heating/AC units. Also room was right above delivery area which contributed to the noise. Overall not a very welcoming feeling at the Chateau. Coffee pot would not work and when I called to request another the woman at the front desk was rude and didn't seem to believe me. The doormen were unpleasant and wouldn't even smile, especially the one in the afternoon. I come to Branson often to visit family and for vacations and I'm sorry to say this will not be my choice of hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, great facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: paty50
Reviews.Content: We visit Branson at least once a year, and finally decided to stay at The Chateau. We are very glad we did, and plan to return in the future. The lady at the reception desk was ver polite, and helpful, as we requested to change rooms to a higher floor. I recommend the lake view rooms, it is special to wake up in the morning with that marvelous view, fresh air and peaceful scenery. Rooms are very confortable, the second sink comes in handy. Breakfast was nice, Sunday Brunch was even better. The indoor pool is small, considering the size of this hotel, and I recommend you get there before the small kids wake up.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: Diane A
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb 20-22 with my son and his 2 boys. We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite (complimentary). The hotel is beautiful. The room was immaculate, the views of the lake from the bedroom and the mountains from the living room were great. We ate in the dining room for dinner and breakfast and it was lovely. Everyone there was so friendly and polite!!! You have a very gracious staff! We were there on a groupon deal and it was well worth every penny! Thank you for the experience!

Reviews.Title: “great for a romantic get away”
Reviews.Author: sept26
Reviews.Content: the hotel and rooms are top if the line the food is amazing and the service so great ! they have pacakge deals u can get .... and do not skip the breakfest so so yummy

Reviews.Title: “Want to be looked down at then stay here”
Reviews.Author: Brianwurst
Reviews.Content: Im a very sucessful local Doctor and we went for a dance competition. We went to the yuppy restaurant to get a couple drinks and appetizer food cause we had just ate. Margaret, the host suggested that people like us should sit in the bar to drink and that it didnt open for another 50 minutes. Nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Margaret612
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at this hotel over this past weekend (Feb 2012). The hotel was very clean, and the beds comfortable. We stayed in a lake view suite, and the additional space was well worth it. The view from our room was spectacular. We had dinner in the Atrium next to a spectacular waterfall. The food was great. The only negative was the tub had a slow running drain (minor). The hotel location is well off the beat and path of busy Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: cmurray942
Reviews.Content: Chateau on the Lake is a beautiful hotel. The hotel staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. The room was beautiful. It was very large with a nice sitting area. Every part of the room was comfortable. The two sinks was very helpful. The room was made up perfectly each day. We went to the Spa Chateau only to use the steam room and whirlpool. It was completely worth the $25. The facility was comfortable and clean. The lounge reminded us of the Peabody in Memphis. It had many comfortable sitting areas, big fireplace and excellent drinks. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for couples and families. Although I traveled with my husband only, the next time we go to Branson we would come back here with our children.

Reviews.Title: “It's no Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: EllerBabe331
Reviews.Content: Lady at check-in was fabulous! The grill breakfast was delicious but our waitress was rude and failed to provide us with drinks. We spoke with management who assigned us another waitress but we didn't go back the next morning. Attitude is everything and McDonald's employees made my morning smoother than the restraunt employees at the Chateau. Housekeeping was impeccable! They did a great job making our room presentable and feel at home! The bed was awful. I would have been better off sleeping on the floor. Cheap mattresses! Final thoughts? We'll be staying at the Hilton next time and canceling our future reservations at the Chateau!

Reviews.Title: “New Years at the Chateau: could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Aviator_and_wife
Reviews.Content: We spent New Years Eve at the party hosted by the hotel. The music was grand and the party well planned. The later departure time gave us ample time to enjoy the morning breakfast. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but avg everything else.”
Reviews.Author: ryanpmoore24
Reviews.Content: The Chateau is a very nice looking hotel. From the outside structural details to the lobby's exquisite decor, the Chateau is one of the nicest looking hotels around. I wish the quality of service, comfort, and value matched the quality of the hotel's overall look. Unfortunately, it doesn't come close. First of all, the beds in the rooms are extremely uncomfortable. The rooms are nice and fairly large, but the beds were horrible. Next, the service is okay, but not great. There was a small crowd in the Sweet Shoppe for breakfast and it seemed that the employees were completely unprepared to serve customers. The food in the Sweet Shoppe is way overpriced. For example, a small box of cereal is $5 and a regular cup of coffee $3.50. There are no microwaves in the rooms, so it's difficult to bring food to make in your room. In addition, the service at the front desk is good, but not great. The people who check you in are accommodating, but not friendly. As far as the amenities go, the pool is nice and the hot tub is large. The fitness center is okay, but very small. Overall, this hotel is gorgeous, but way overpriced. The location is okay depending on what you're looking for. It is secluded which is great if you want that. It's a good 10-15 minutes to the main drag in Branson and about 25 min (could be longer with traffic) to Branson Landing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings, beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Poissonoeuf
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a recent Groupon discount opportunity to stay at the Chateau on the Lake during the off-peak season. This is a fantastic way to experience a resort without the costs or hassles you can incur during the peak season. This hotel is modeled somewhat after the Embassy Suites hotel chain with an open atrium in the center of the hotel, and the rooms are positioned around the atrium. The suites in the hotel are even laid out somewhat the same, but the furnishings and finishes are of a higher caliber, and the bedding is plush. But that's where the comparison ends. This hotel boasts a beautiful and large "Library/bar" room with a wrap-around bar and a flagstone fireplace. Drinks are a bit pricy, but the ambience is wonderful. The spa is even more impressive, with two separate and large relaxation areas (one for men, one for women), requisite saunas and dressing facilities, and a complete line of treatments. The "co-ed" area that contains the whirlpool is a bit small, but it's private, and there is access to a secluded outdoor area as well. The spa doesn't offer too much in the way of food or beverages, but there are a few interesting choices if you choose to stay there for any length of time. Treatments are on the pricey side, but the staff seems to know their stuff. There is a theater in the bottom of the hotel that provides nightly movies (when it's not reserved for a private party), and in indoor pool for visitors who don't use the spa facilities. There's also a small workout room - but warning, absolutely NO children 16 or younger are allowed in the workout room, under any conditionsl. Staff was courteous and helpful. We had no trouble with check in or check out. All in all, a good value for the price we paid. Not sure we can afford this hotel during peak season though.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JCretired
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the hotel. The rooms were very nice and clean. We stayed for a few days during the Christmas season and it was beautifully decorated. The restaurants were a little pricey but the 'Sweet Shop' was reasonable priced....and had GREAT carrot cake!!! We were given a lake side room on the eight floor and the view of Tablerock lake was super. This is a 'Pet Friendly' hotel (which I didn't know about until we arrived there) Pets were allowed on the 3rd floor only. No problems in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Rileyjr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, but keep in mind that there is no complimentary breakfast here. The restaurants are excellent and pricy. Be prepared to pay a lot for meals or drive a ways to eat at local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “They say its a 5 star, but it is 4 at the most”
Reviews.Author: Frank T
Reviews.Content: Appearance is great both inside and out, The registration staff was average at best. Rooms were large and clean, but not 5 star. They have a great bar and coffee bar, but the restaurants were POOR.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Spa”
Reviews.Author: Tina P
Reviews.Content: We went to the Chateau on a business trip and brought our 2 children, 7 and 10. They loved the Sweet shop and the breakfast where they could serve themselvles. I was blown away by the view, and the luxurious towels. Our beds, bathroom and decor were all outstanding. A visit to the luxury spa was included for me through the company plan, and I've never felt so pampered. This is no ordinary hotel spa. I got a massage that was both relaxing and energizing. The staff there and everywhere was first rate. So polite! One thing I might change is to enlarge or add on another pool. For such a luxurious property they really could have a few water slides, a lazy river or kids basketball. Maybe the Chateau is geared more towards adults, but it felt safe and friendly for our family. If we get the opportunity to go back, we certainly will!

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as expected.”
Reviews.Author: sarasmithjane
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay at the Chateau and finally got to the first weekend of December. The hotel is very nice looking on the outside but I was disapointed in our room. We booked a lakefront king ambassador suite and when we first walked in I thought they'd given us the wrong room. It was decent sized but not near as nice and luxurious as I thought it would be. There were large cobwebs on the ceilings in both the living area and the bedroom. We never ate at the restaurants but did get some desserts at the sweet shop. It was very good and reasonably priced. The view was nice and I'm sure we would have enjoyed our stay much better if we had come during the warmer months. I really wanted to go the spa but decided to save my money as it was very expensive. We didn't really have much interaction with the staff except to check in and out. The birds in the atrium that everyone else complained about didn't bother us. Our room was back in a corner so we couldn't hear them. Overall I thought the rooms were very overpriced for what they were and I'm not sure if we'd ever stay again. Maybe if we could afford the Presidential suites. Maybe they would be worth the price. .

Reviews.Title: “The name really fits!”
Reviews.Author: firstnlast
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed the first weekend in November. We had a corner king suite and the room was very nice, the bed was comfortable, the front desk staff were very friendly and the room service the next morning was very good. We had a balcony and the views from our room over the lake with the fall colors and sunset were beautiful. The only negative would be the hot tub. They only have one inside which accommodates 6 or 8 people which for a hotel this size is insufficient because there were a lot of people there every time we tried to use it. We waited by the pool for an hour and unfortunately there was one couple who stayed in it the entire time we were down there. It only has jets on one end and that couple set in front of them the entire time and another lady was carrying on a very loud conversation on her cell phone for at least 30 minutes. I told my husband I could take a hot bath in the room without having to put up with loud and rude people so we gave up on it. I've had multiple back surgeries so when we are looking to book a hotel our criteria are that it be clean, have a comfortable bed, friendly staff and an indoor hot tub, every thing else is bonus so I would say 3 out of 4 is pretty good. It's a beautiful place and we would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lux accomodations in Branson”
Reviews.Author: lady_di0809
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I did not have high expectations of Branson or the lodging there. I was very pleasantly surprised by both. Chateau on the Lake has the look and feel of a Fairmont property. Rooms were a good size, though maybe a little dark. I enjoyed dining at all of their restaurant options...though their lattes were terrible. The fried avocado sticks and the bar snack mix with wasabi peas were both delicious and memorable. They have a great spa on site and one of the top ranked public golf courses in the country nearby. For adults, Branson offers an amazing amount of live shows for very reasonable prices, and the Titanic Museum is a must see. I was very impressed with the options Branson offers for families with children of all ages. From out door activities involving the lake, hiking, horseback riding, etc., to year round options like the waterpark, Ripleys, Butterfly Palace, Wax Museum and more. Seems like a great alternative to the theme park vacations. If you are traveling to Branson, then the Chateau is definitely the nice hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: Hoppy9531
Reviews.Content: We love staying here on our vacations! A very nice hotel overlooking the lake. The restraunt is very nice and the food is great. Always have a great stay here. The hotel staff was friendly and made us feel at home. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jeffhedges
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me give you some background. I was in Oklahoma City, and would be returning back home to Indiana this weekend. Last spring we stopped by Branson on the way home and thought about doing so again. I stumbled across the COTL and decided to call. The lady who I talked to was very helpful. She stated she would make a note to get me a room on the 10th floor for a better view of the lake and she did as our room was on the10th floor. (Lake front room). Secondly, I read every single review of this hotel. All 20 pages of them. After reading these reviews and after staying at the COTL this past Saturday night, I got to say some of the reviews are uncalled for. Some I can understand especially concerning any bad service, but some reviews are just nit-picking. You have to realize you are at an expensive hotel. They have expensive costs. One thing that did bother me was there was a common theme people were disappointed with over a 2-3 year period and appeared to never get fixed, and that was the food service area. I kept saying to myself, Stephen appears to be active on this forum, and reads the reviews, but people keep giving the food service and quality bad reviews. How can this not get fixed. (After my experience, I wonder if some were nit-picking). Now on to my review. Arrived Saturday night at 5:00pm. Based on all my readings I was going to quantify this place with my own personal experiences while there. We pulled up at the hotel, and of course was greeted by the bell hop. I immediately told him we didn't have much luggage and we were just going to check in real quick. He said ok, and I had to hand over my keys while inside checking in. Check-in went real smooth. A man checked us in, was real professional, and was quick. We walked back out out and parked the car. We walked back in the hotel and went to our room to dump the luggage. The wife and I decided to walk around and check out the hotel. We walked all around the hotel and I thought about having a quick drink before we got cleaned up for dinner. We went to the lounge which all the bar seating was taken. My wife and I sat at a table and was not sure whether they come to the table or not. So I walked up to the bar to order a drink. (Now I'm giving the place a pass on this) But, no bartender came soon, so I turned around and told the wife, we'd just get some Diet Coke and mix a drink back in the room. Now I didn't stay at the bar a long time, So I can't fault the place for anything here. I do want to say, the lounge layout just didn't click with me. I would liked a bigger bar so many people could sit at it. Make a square bar with TV's on all 4 sides and more people can sit at it. I dunno, the lounge just didn't feel welcome to me for some reason. Ok, so we decided to get a couple of Diet Cokes at the Coffee shop before we went to our room. This place was incredible with the choice of cakes and desserts. The lady behind the counter was extremely nice and provided great service. We headed back to the room and had a drink before dinner. Ok, We didn't want to spend a ton of money at the Grille, so we decided to go to the other restaurant which was a tad more lower priced. Plus, we wanted to sit in the atrium with a view while dining. I thought eating out on the atrium was a great idea. I told the person seating us I wanted to sit at a table with a good view, which she accommodated. Josh, was our waiter, and took our drink and appetizer order quickly. It did take a tad amount of time to get the drinks, and when they came the beer wasn't very cold. I told Josh, I wanted him to know the beer wasn't very cold, and ordered another beer. He said he knew what to do and would make the next beer colder. Indeed he did. The second beer was very cold. I don't know if he frosted the glass or what but the beer was much colder. Even the wife thought her first beer was not very cold. For the appetizer, we had the avocado fries which I had read in a review were good. They lived up to the previous review. They were awesome. We then ordered the Haddock fish and were delivered to us in 11 minutes from the time we ordered to being delivered to out table. The Fish was very good, along with the cole slaw, and fries. I would like to have had more cole slaw, but it is what it is. Josh should be commended for his service. At times, he was 1/2 running back and forth. It almost appeared they were short staffed. I looked around if this was the case, but I had mixed emotions whether they were or not. Sometimes waiters like to be more busy with more tips, then not as busy with less tips. Other staff were delivering food and clearing tables so it appeared to be worked out. Overall, I would say our dining experience was two thumbs up. I was concerned about this after reading the reviews. This was a common theme in the reviews about the dinning experience at the COTL. Now the room. Incredible, just incredible. I could not find one fault in the room. Extremely upscale and comfy. The TV sound in the bathroom was cool. Go an extra step and put a TV in the bathroom. This would definitely make a mark with your hotel providing this service. I have a TV in my bathroom at home and enjoy this. The bed was too soft for me. Some might like that, but I like hard beds. The bathroom and the room was especially spacious. In summary, I loved the place. I already want to come back, more so when it's warm so I can enjoy the facilities better. I hope this review help some in people with their decision whether or not to stay here. This is a very nice hotel. They have expensive costs in maintaining this hotel. I understand the prices. Don't like it, but heck I'm staying at a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences you will have....”
Reviews.Author: Dadsheart5
Reviews.Content: We went to Chateau on the Lake for a home school leadership conference. From the minute we stepped foot on the property until we left it was a great experience. From the beginning.... when you check in the doorman are terrific, with a great attitude, willing to help with initial questions. The rroms are large enough and decorated with class, but what will blow you away is the balcony and the view from your room. The river and the sunsets are stunning. Well, all bags to the room, then I am off to the concierge for show tickets! She was absolutely great, weeding through our preferences and in a minute Sight and Sound and now off to view the property, The center couryard is stunning with magnificent waterfalls and many places to simply sit and relax. Now to food. The breakfast buffet is terrific. Service help great, views unbelievable. I will try to upload some pictures. Overall attitude of all staff fantastic....and this coming from a New Yorker......Also, do not miss Silver Dollar City....and the Branson Belle.....

Reviews.Title: “could use an update”
Reviews.Author: Bub1597
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful outside and in the atrium, it was decorated for christmas and looked very nice. The rooms were clean and ok but they could use an update. I could hear people in the other rooms and in the hall at night. I also did not like hearing the birds that they keep in the lobby making noise all day. I also found that most of the staff at the reception desk were not friendly. I normally stay at the hilton promenade on branson landing and find that everyone there is more than friendly and happy to greet you. I will continue to stay at the hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing trip with my husband”
Reviews.Author: KC2833
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a convention at the Chateau. This is the 4th time I have stayed at this hotel and love it even more. This was the first time I have been when it was decorated for Christmas. It was so beautiful with the lights and Christmas trees. I agree up a little early but I sure enjoyed and got me in the holiday spirt. My husband and I got a King Ambassador Suite. I think this is the best way to go. It had a very nice sitting room with a couch and chair. We also had a refrigerator and microwave that we used alot and saved money. We brought water and pop with us and saved us buying that had microvave popcorn and snacks to save money also. The bathroom was just big enough and the bedroom was huge. The bed was very comfortable and I slept well. It was nice to have a Tv in the bedroom and sitting area as my husband and I don't agree on things all the time! We were on the third floor and did not have a balcony. But with this weather did not really need one. In the early fall and spring it would be nice. We were right by the entrance to the hotel but never heard any noises and that was nice. We were right across from the stair entrance which was great as we just walked down to the lobby. It can get busy on the elevators and that saved alot of time. My husband and I ate the breakfast buffet two mornings and thought it was great. The omelettes were the best. For the price $13.99 (including drinks) it was a great deal. Also, enjoyed a nice eveing in the Libary Lounge having some wine and enjoying the great piano player on a Saturday night. I have never gotten to stay here with my kids and want to some time. In the summer it is great for kids as has the outdoor pool and playground. Beach nearby and you can rent boats to go on the lake. They have an indoor movie theater and kids club also. So next summer plan to come back with the kids. It is away from Branson which I love. I am not a lover at all of the Branson strip so stay away from it. You get that here but also within a 15 min drive to the strip. We found two good places to eat on road going into Branson. Mexican place Mi Casa Su Casa just opened and it was great. I loved my meal. Also, Dana's barbecue is a great place and save some money by eating there. All in all a great place and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Brason, MO”
Reviews.Author: Kya02
Reviews.Content: If you want to be 10 minutes away from the Theatre district without all the traffic, hustle and bustle then stay at Chateau on the Lake. It's views ( depending on which room ) are stunning. We were in a Lake View room with balcony. The King size room was huge with sitting area and the views of Table Rock Lake were wonderful. Our room was very clean, bed comfortable and the Atrium food delicious. There is a huge wrap around deck on the property and every day the chairs were full. Best views are from this deck! We were very happy with the fall beauty of Branson and the location of Chateau. Many options of hiking/walking trails close by. If nature is your passion, then be sure to spend a half day at Dogwood Nature Park. An absolutely gorgeous area. You can rent bikes, walk, fly fish etc. Only 30 minutes from the Chateau. We will definately stay here again on our next visit to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: FHRH
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day break at the Chateau on the Lake. The hotel itself needs a bit of an update. The room was lovely, but not as clean as it could have been. The bed was quite lumpy, and felt old and ready to be renewed. (We have been spoiled by other hotel chains that have pillowtop mattresses). The rooms were all built around an atrium, and they were in the middle of putting up the Christmas decorations. The hotel had no atmosphere. It was quite weird. The closet had mirrored folding/sliding doors, which were quite stiff and very noisy. We could hear the closet being opened in the next room. Sounded like they were dragging furniture across a wooden floor! The rooms had carpets! On the up side. The hotel restaurant served lovely food, and the staff in there were very friendly and helpful. The housekeeper was also very friendly. The hotel itself has wonderful views, and beautifully landscaped gardens. My morning at the Spa was perfect. The best massage therapist I have had, she actually listened to what I wanted, and resisted the temptation to tackle the knots she found deep inside my back! The first one that has ever resisted the urge, which made the massage so much more relaxing. The two of us, (the therapist and myself), had so much fun, we spent a lot of the time swapping stories and giggling! Would we go back? Probably not. But to be fair, the weather was cold and it rained for two of our 4 days. The only two full days we had there!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great the second time”
Reviews.Author: WCN_11
Reviews.Content: On our first stay at the Chateau in May of this year everything was first-rate. The beds were comfortable and seemed really clean, plenty of plush towels, great meals--a fun, luxurious experience. For our visit this time we upgraded to a lake view room with balcony so we could enjoy the fall foliage. We excitedly opened the door to the "balcony" and were assaulted by the noise from the air conditioning units. The lake view rooms are on the back on the hotel so you also get treated to the sight of the dumpster, cooking smells, and the noise of early morning truck deliveries. The beds were saggy and uncomfortable and the pillows were flat. The shower dial fell off anytime we adjusted the water temp and the towels were thin and rough. The meals were good, as was the service. The hotel was already decorated for Christmas so that was enjoyable. We still like enough about the Chateau to give it one more chance. But I think I will ask to see the room first.

Reviews.Title: “Fall weekend at the Chateau”
Reviews.Author: Jparlante
Reviews.Content: The last weekend of October 2011 was a wonderful cornucopia of fall colors around Table Rock Lake in Branson, Missouri. The hotel was decorated for Christmas! There is an excellent menu in the dining room and the Sunday brunch is magnificent. The Spa and treatments are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful resort”
Reviews.Author: LALA B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a weekend stay at the Chateau. We had forgotten how relaxing and stunningly beautiful this property is. We were upgraded to a suite on the 11th floor with an amazing view of the lake. The room was elegantly decorated with every thought to our comfort (including an extra vanity area outside the bathroom). The bar has a great pianist and a great atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely return here on our next Branson trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: physann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 day stay at the Chateau. Last year we stayed at the Hilton at Branson Landings but this year we thought we would stay at a lake front property. The hotel is very beautiful - it is high on a hill and makes quite an impression as you approach it. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. We dined on the terrace overlooking the lake on Friday night, our server was most accommodating and knowledgeable. Sunday brunch was terrific - very good selection. Considering this hotel is not that old, I thought the room decor was a little 70's i.e. lots of brown tile in the bathroom, but otherwise the bed was comfortable. It's a little drive from the strip, but that's part of it's charm and beware Mapquest does not give accurate directions. Had to stop and ask for directions. When we finally drove up, the doormen said that Mapquest does not have them in their system. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “SPA is a white-glove experience.”
Reviews.Author: BransonNative
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Spa Chateau, since I didn't stay at the hotel itself. Wow! This is the most beautiful, relaxing spa in the area (Branson/Springfield/Harrison). It is also the largest. You will receive white-glove service from the moment you walk in. It's huge -- areas for hot tub, steam, co-ed spa, ladies and gentlemen's lounges, several treatment rooms and an image studio for hair/nails/make-up. They will offer you something to drink, see if you want a snack, and by the time you leave you will agree with me that it is the most complete spa experience you can have. I highly recommend the signature pedicure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: leslieh33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau for two nights in August for a meeting of my husband's. The room was large with a king size bed and a couch. We did not have a lake view but could see the water and the mountain out of the window. It was well run and friendly. We ate dinner and lunch in their restaurant and the food was good. The pool is overlooking the water and there are two tennis courts that are in very good shape. The grounds are well tended and offer great places to walk. I would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This should be in the top 4 hotels in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Sunbather08
Reviews.Content: I am stunned how this beautiful hotel could ever get less than an excellent rating. I had to leave a review and encourage others to do the same. 13 years ago on our honeymoon, my hubby and I looked up at Chateau and thought...maybe one day we could afford to stay there. It was a dream we finally realized last fall for our 12th anniversary. We were elated and the fall colors in Branson never disappoint. The drive to the Chateau is even an experience with the beautiful Lake views and the winding drive. We were blown away by a helicopter landing nearby and a lovely couple exiting...just for a nice dinner! WOW! The grounds were breathtaking and made for some lovely photo memories for us. Our room was a nice king bed with an enclosed balcony with a great view of the sunrise. Even though we weren't facing the lake, no view here disappoints. The bedroom & bathroom were very spacious and lovely. We took advantage of the gym, which offered a couple of treadmills, stair master & some weight machines. It was small but everything we needed was there and we loved the view while working out.
