The staff was setting up for an outdoor sunset wedding and we loved sitting outside on the main balcony with lots of chairs and benches to view the lake and take in the autumn air. This was a great way to celebrate and have a romantic weekend getaway and truly a dream of ours finally realized. We can't wait to return and utilize the spa and try the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice weekend family respite away from the cheesiness that is central Branson”
Reviews.Author: satellite1
Reviews.Content: My family and I wanted to spend Labor Day weekend somewhere within a reasonable driving distance from St. Louis, and decided that Branson could fit the bill. We wanted to stay at a hotel/resort that had many amenities on-site, as we did not want to spend too much of our precious family time driving from place to place. Frankly, we wanted to stay at Big Cedar Lodge, but it was booked, and this seemed like the second-best option. At any rate, things worked out in that we decided we wanted to take our dog that we had adopted a month ago with us, as he was not ready to be left in a kennel for an entire weekend, and this place has pet-friendly rooms. Overall, it was a good choice! The name of the hotel gives perhaps an impression of European luxuriousness, but I would more aptly characterize this hotel as a bastion of relaxed Midwestern helpfulness and friendliness. All of the employees, from the doormen to the restaurant servers to the pool waitstaff to the housekeeping staff, were helpful and truly friendly, yet not in a pompous way as you may sometimes see at, say, the Ritz or the Four Seasons. For the first two days we spent time with our kids (7 and 5) at the outdoor pool and at Moonshine Beach, which is a very small beach a two-minute drive from the hotel. We also watched a movie in the in-house theatre and went to the marina. We ate all of our meals on the property, including breakfast at the Atrium (their more casual lobby dining spot), dinner outside on the balcony (which was VERY pleasant and breezy), ice cream and coffee from the pastry shop, and a Sunday afternoon brunch buffet. The food in general was very good and nicely prepared. I loved that you could eat lunch poolside, and have drinks brought to your pool chair...nothing beats a poolside Bloody Mary. Yes, some of the food and drinks were somewhat pricey, but not terribly so...in general that is what you get when you want it brought to you without having to move from your hotel or even your chair. The hotel is rather removed from central Branson and its strips of, dare I say, cheesy and nondescript low-lying buildings laid out in strip mall-esque fashion. I rather liked that, though...for us it was nice to be able to escape to a show (in our case the Shanghai Acrobats) and then drive back to our secluded oasis of a hotel; for us, even if we were in the entertainment mecca that is Branson, the enjoyment of the hotel amenities is what we were looking for for our vacation. The room itself that we had booked was slightly dated, I thought, with a Fairfield Suites flair to it (think maroon and hunter green color scheme, nondescript generic landscape fake-o oil painting), but perhaps this is because it was one of the pet-friendly rooms that overlooks the back parking lot...some of their other rooms could be more updated. If you want luxury that pulls out all the stops, go find a Ritz somewhere and pay top dollar...if you want a low-key relaxed break in the Midwest where you can take in a show or two and easily entertain and feed your children at a more reasonable price, stay at the Chateau.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Time”
Reviews.Author: ch5082
Reviews.Content: Weather was so-so for our family trip to Branson, but we still had fun. We visited mid-week for cheaper rates and paid average of $160/night for a basic room. The room was clean. Extra towels were easy to come by. The pools were nice. It was nice to have the indoor pool because of the rain, although I enjoyed swimming laps outside in the rain once everyone hurried inside. They do have kids activities - movies and a kids club, but we weren't able to take advantage of these. The Chateau is not on the strip, which is nice. It is not far from it either. I think it has a really good location if you find yourself going back and forth several times. I also suggest visiting downtown Branson and the Landing area just past downtown along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ScottCindyHarvey
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone at Chateau for such an awesome vacation stay...everyone on your staff was so friendly and accommodating, the room was so comfortable and CLEAN, and the grounds simply beautiful! We will definitely be back and recommend Chateau to all of our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want a wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjflo2
Reviews.Content: I did not choose this hotel due to the bad reviews -- A BIG MISTAKE!!! We came to dinner here and were blown away. So much so that we cancelled our reservation for our last night at another property and book a room here at the Chateau!! All the while kicking myself for not booking our entire stay here in the first place!! It's a beautiful property with an incredible view. The restaurant and lounge were excellent!! The staff was so very polite and friendly. This hotel, alone, makes me want to return to Branson!! If you're looking for class, elegance and comfort at all levels, this is your place!! If you want to have a full kitchen in the room or have space for several folks, this isn't going to be the place for you. This is a venue for folks looking to be pampered during their hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Took me to the bank. STEER CLEAR”
Reviews.Author: Just B
Reviews.Content: They have the rates listed on the back of door for the maximum they charge for the room, and they really overcharged me. They sent a manager to my room and he was unwilling to resolve the issue. None of the extras are included, everything will cost you. The 4th of July BBQ food was bland and definately not worth the per plate price. Fireworks from our top floor room was spectacular. Room was furnished and decorated very well. Would never stay here and I have made this clear to anyone who tells me they are going to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it (more than Hawaii!) coming back!!”
Reviews.Author: ReneMelanie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with a separate King bedroom. Awesome room. Loved the privacy, since traveling with our kids, who slept on the sofabed. LOVED the little extra touches for the kids, like Lucky the Bear delivering milk and warm cookies fri & Sat nights (should do this every night though :) in case someone isn't staying over a weekend), the free movies in the mini theater, although I never saw the free popcorn, but we missed the beginning of every movie we saw so maybe they handed it out when we weren't there, also the dive-in movies in the pool at night, the kids loved that too. I thought it was very relaxing too lounging in the chaise while they played in the pool and we all watched it. LOVED getting ice cream and sweets at the Sweet Shoppe every night and sitting on the veranda overlooking the lake and sunset to eat it. SOOOO relaxing and peaceful, especially with the cooler evening air. (could turn off the fake bullfrog recording though, that was loud and annoying). I asked upon checkin for a free upgrade to a lakeview if they had it, even though I only reserved mountain view. They said they had 'partial lakeview' available during my whole stay so they gave us that. The window out of the living room therefore overlooked the convention center roof-ick, but the balcony and view from the bedroom was of the lake and dam and absolutely gorgeous! I sat out there every evening enjoying the peace and view. We found the staff to be extremely nice and helpful. Every time we saw a bellhop they opened the door and we always thanked them. My girls remembered the name of our bellhop who showed us our room so whenever we saw him they were sure to address him by name and say hi. The restaurant staff was very personable, we had the same waitress for breakfast buffet the two days we ate there (she was from Kimberling City, forgot her name). She was great and very professional and helpful, she also always gave us a table right by the window overlooking the lake, which of course I loved :) I will say, that the first night we were there we ate dinner in the cafe atrium and was unimpressed by the food portions compared to the prices. In that atrium setting I would expect a little less price. That was the reason we headed to Branson for most of the rest of our meals until Sunday when we decided based on our boating reservation we should eat at the hotel to save time. That is when we had the opportunity to sit in the 'fancier' section of the dining and try the buffet, and both were great! We absolutely loved this hotel. We paid about $50 more per night to stay at the Grand Wailea in Maui a few years ago. The rooms here at the Chateau are a million times nicer. Granted, part of your room price is to pay for the amenities of the 'resort' and Hawaii has the ocean a few steps away and the Grand Wailea had a GREAT pool system (sandy beach pool/slides/rope swing/lazy river etc). But even with all that, my husband was unimpressed with our Hawaiian trip. But here at the Chateau, he said he really liked it and would definately come back. That says a lot from my husband! I myself, definately loved it!!!! Loved the robes, and the bedding too! The only ladies 'shopping' store was definately geared towards grandma's though. I am 40 with two kids under 10 and nothing in that store was attractive to me...except they had a small Brighton section in the back, which I did end up buying some earrings and a bracelet from. A younger clientele would like different clothing though. There is only one outdoor pool and there is nothing special about it. But the kids had fun in it. I really like the pool movie though. The atrium is beautiful and we really loved our vacation here. We will be back. We also went to the marina where they have free canoes/kayaks/paddle boats. We rented ski boats and had a ball. I like that you can bring your own boat and lauch it here, we will do this next time. The Library Lounge has really comfortable seating for relaxing and chilling out (reading/talking/etc).Love this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Watch you’r bank account!!!! $$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: SPORTSGODDESS
Reviews.Content: Don’t waste your time or money on a room here. My friend & I stayed here for my birthday & every time we turned around they were trying to make us pay for something we did not want or receive. During the reservation process they guaranteed us a bottle of wine with the room @ no extra cost, but surprise my bank card was charged! There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room, because they want you to spend more $$ @ their restaurants or you could of paid $20 more per day to have a microwave in the room. In the bathroom as soon as you walk in there is a bottle of water for you if you are willing to spend $3.00. My bed was broke, the water temp did not work correctly, the view was nonexistent, the ice machine on our floor did not work, & so much more. Plus you are 10 mins away from EVERYTHING! The only good thing about this location is the valet attendants & the SPA. The valet attendants were very gracious & tentative & kind. At the spa we spent the day being pampered by the wonderful massage specialist, along with the whirlpool and steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nicely done”
Reviews.Author: rmcowan
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful spot and a nice place. The facility is top notch and the people are very nice and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Navigator48614
Reviews.Content: After reading earlier reviews I was concerned that the facilities and expereince would not be as nice as I had hoped. From the description of the room we rented I thought it would be tight quarters. I was pleasantly surprised to find the atmosphere and facilities to be excellent. We stayed in a small suite, bedroom and a pull out couch. We had plenty of room and were very comfortable. The pull out couch was of excellent quality and slept better than some beds I have expereinced during travels. We stayed during the John Hagee ministeries event. The Chateau staff did an excellent job handling the large crowd staying at the hotel and those that came in for the sessions. The Chateau made a nice Spring Break destination for these Michigan travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful atmosphere - lacking amenities”
Reviews.Author: Wary_Traveler_11
Reviews.Content: This is the second trip my wife and I have spent at the Chateau. This time our family and friends decided to stay at the Chateau based on our recommendation. Pros: The accommodations were nice. The room was clean. The staff was helpful. The boat marina was organized and very accommodating. The boat we rented was very clean and had no issues. Good ice cream in the sweet shoppe. Free newspaper. Cons: The hotel is starting to show its age. The hallway carpet is buckling and looks worn. We really needed two queen beds instead of the double beds offered. There were not enough convenient electrical outlets in the room. The lack of in-room free internet access is not acceptable in this day and age. The sweet shoppe prices were outrageous ($2.50 for a small can of pop). Would not allow us to use the luggage cart without a bellman coming with us. We booked a lakeview room at a higher cost, our friends booked a mountainview room at a lower cost, we were on the same side of the hotel (go figure).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay!”
Reviews.Author: mcavStCharles_Mo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7/29-7/31. We had reserved a Lake Front King but at check-in were asked if we would want to be upgraded to a Ambassasor Suite at half the price (apparently there was a booking problem). We took the upgrade and had an awesome suite on the 10th floor. The room had a sitting room w/ pull out sofa for the kids, wet bar with fridge and microwave, and a bedroom with 2 doubles. For the price we paid, this was an amazing room. Everything at the hotel was clean and in good condition. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We ate dinner at the atrium bar and got lunch at the deli. Both meals were very good. The Big Boy burger at the atrium bar was terrific. The resort has alot of activities. The kids loved milk and cookies delivered to our room by Lucky the Bear. Friday night they had a poolside movie. We took out paddle boats from the marina (no charge) and played basketball. They Aldo have a kids club. We did not use this aknd from what I can tell it didn't look like many others did. We did check out the kids club room when we got the basketball and it looked pretty cool. Only one complaint: the hotel appeared to be short staffed for the poolside bar service and at the atrium restaurant. The servers were working hard but the hotel was fully booked and there was only one server on Friday night at both places. Despite that, we had a great stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, serene room-- the spa is excellent”
Reviews.Author: MarieMom25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a favorite spot for "mommy getaways." Once a year, friends and I book a suite and enjoy spa treatments and girl talk. The rooms are always clean, quiet, and comfy. No complaints whatsoever. The spa is fantastic. I've never had a bad massage/treatment there and it is definitely the best in the area. (I've tried quite a few). It is perfect for a girls weekend, as it offers a relaxation lounge that spa clients can use before/after treatments. We love hanging out and chatting in this lovely room.

Reviews.Title: “Simple luxury”
Reviews.Author: DarekJarmola
Reviews.Content: This review is based on 3 days stay at the hotel. Check-in and checkout were very simple and quick. Friendly and professional staff all alround. Rooms are specious and clean. Beds are king size, but on a soft side. Showers are good (water pressure) and bathrooms have twice the towels needed (nice touch as the resort has indoor and outdoor pools as well as workout gym and tennis courts). Beatifull views from most of the rooms (lake view rooms cost more, mountain view are less expensive). The hotel offer plenty of packaged deals - my recommendation is to take advantage of one of these. Excellent spa facilities and range of services - even if a bit pricey. Meals are served by two establishments here - again a bit pricey. We opted for 5 minutes ride for marity of our meals on the Hwy 76. The resort - depending on the time of the week and year- may be very crowded as the conference center is a part of this huge compelex. At other times, there are more families than couples. So, when booking - best if directly with the hotel - ask what kind of events are scheduled for that time to determine if you want to be here at that time.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing retreat”
Reviews.Author: jailmaiden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before he deployed with the Army. It was so peaceful. The area is beautiful. The staff went out of their way to make our stay something to remember. Some of the small details of this resort really make a difference. The ice cream shop packed up banana spits for us to take to our room. The cafe restaurant had the best food. We can't wait to go back. Waking up to the chirping birds and the trickle of the water in the indoor atrium made for a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe they wouldn't grant us a late checkout to 12:30pm!!!”
Reviews.Author: 81Devil
Reviews.Content: This was our 14th consecutive year staying for at least a week at the Chateau while our child(ren) attend Kanakuk Kamp. You would think we could get an hour and a half late checkout but NO!!! We have to leave the Chateau at 6:20 a.m. to get to the Kamp for closing ceremonies which ends at 10:00 a.m. then have to drive the minimum 45 minutes back to the Chateau, that gives us 15 minutes for them to take good showers after a week away, get their trunks/duffel bags repacked to accommodate the 50-pound weight limit at the airport, and get out of the room, that is an impossible task. Over the 14 years, we have recommended the Kamp and the Chateau to several family members or friends who have now become regulars. And yet, we couldn't get a late checkout????

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Old School”
Reviews.Author: 306fathead
Reviews.Content: Reminded me of those big old resorts up east. Food nothing great. Pool was too small for all the people, nothing festive about it music put me asleep. They need a seperate pool for the adults. CARPET..everywhere. Nothing special about the rooms..Great Fireworks

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jt45
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this resort, and our expectations were exceeded!! From the time we entered to the day we left the staff was wonderful, the hotel was very clean, the view was breathtaking. There was so much to do right on the property that there was no need to leave (though we did for a bit). My children loved that they set up a movie screen, poolside and played a kids movie on Friday night, while they swam. Cookies and milk delivered to the room by a cute bear made their night more amazing. The next day we rented a boat, also rented a waverunner. Those were a first for our kids... they loved it! We also used the paddleboats which was very fun too! Wish there were more hotels of this caliber around... they set the bar very high! We are already planning our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “20yr Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: dsk6320
Reviews.Content: We come to branson/SDC each year and usually stay on the strip closer to everything, but this year was just the wife and I for our 20yr anniversary and decided to stay at the Chateau this time.. I also reserved her a double spa package and it was an amazing experience for the both of us, little too pricey for an ordinary stay but will use again for those special occasions that we want to have lasting memories of.

Reviews.Title: “Our Family had a great experience over Memorial weekend”
Reviews.Author: Travelwboys
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a 6 hour drive early afternoon and were greeted by a helpful bell staff. We took advantage of the valet and luggage service. It was $15 extra a day, but my husband feels it’s worth it and afterwards I had to agree. There didn't seem to be alot of close convenient parking and with two young kids it was nice having the car waiting and someone to help with our stuff when we got back each time. We had a king with a mountain view. The room was clean and big enough for our two boys to have their blow-up beds on the floor and still have plenty of walking space. We also liked that there was a clothes hamper for towels in the bathroom, just a nice little detail. A mini-fridge would be a great addition to the rooms considering the caliber of hotel, but not worth $20 a day extra. We already had a cooler from the drive so we just continued to use that for our drinks. We ate at the Chateau Grill early afternoon and it was ok. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet the next morning - Now that was really good. Everything was fresh and hot, the made-to-order omelets and waffles were outstanding, and the service was good too. One of the evenings we inquired about ordering and taking our meal up to our room since it was so late and the hostess didn't seem to have any problem with us doing that. We ended up getting room service and the delivery server was extremely nice. Wish I had noted his name, think it was Michael. We enjoyed the outdoor pool and the kids liked the playground, but did not get to take advantage of the children’s movie theater and kids club. The concierge helped us with directions and Branson activities for the kids. Thought the location was great. It is centrally located enough that you are only a short drive away from most of the attractions. The only complaint I had was the Memorial Day dinner. When we checked in, we received a list of hotel activities for the guests. Make sure to inquire as to whether there are additional fees on those. One activity was a BBQ cookout and fireworks by the pool on Sunday evening. Considering the price per night, I never even thought there would be such a high charge, maybe a nominal fee... The BBQ dinner was $24 per adult and I believe it was half that for children over 3. We drop $60 on dinner often enough, but not for outdoor bbq.... So we skipped that - and considering only a handful of people were eating, it looked like alot of others did too... and just got drinks, swam and watched the fireworks - which were awesome! Overall, our experience was great, and we would definitely go back and stay here. We have also recommended this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Better places for the price exist”
Reviews.Author: gurfinkel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed the weekend at the château. We paid 200/night. Pros: it was clean and beds comfortable. Cons: Internet access not included in room price, and picture quality on television Poor. Bottom line is there are better hotels at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: ao7808
Reviews.Content: I took a trip to this Hotel for a business seminar. I travel weekly and am a Hilton Honors Member. I have never felt compelled to write a review about a Hotel until i visited this one. The good: It overlooks the lake and there are awesome views from each room. The Bad: The restaurants are HORRIBLE!!!! I travel on a weekly basis and am not the typical picky person who picks on every detail about a hotel. I ordered a drink after the conference I attended and was Id'd, which is absolutely no problem as I look fairly younger than what I actually am. However, the bartender decided to take my ID away and not say anything and be gone for close to twenty minutes. I work for a Fortune 500 company that specializes in Identity theft so I immediately asked for the manager as this is a HUGE "Red Flag" when your identity is taken behind closed doors. The manager came out and basically started arguing with me in front of all the customers. I tried to explain to him that I had absolutely no problem with them examining my ID, The only problem I had was taking my ID behind closed doors. The manager ended up raising his voice and not even apologizing for what happened. I have never, from a business standpoint, dealt with someone so unprofessional and behind the times. I honestly wonder if the manger was abusing drugs (not even trying to be funny). This experience ruined the trip for me as I am sure it would for anyone who chose to stay here. I am not one of these unrealistic people who post on this website with expectations that are sky high and write a bad review when innocent people don't meet them. But because of this experience I would definitely not recommend this Hotel. If you are going to pay the money, stay at the Hilton. I have never had a problem with them and this resort is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: auxvasse
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for the next to lowest rate we could get during off season, but it still wasn't cheep. Was expecting grand luxury, but it wasn't that wonderful, but it was nice. We were told we could park in the garage around the corner and so we refused help with our luggage (tried to save a few easy bucks). That was a mistake. The garage entrance is in the end of the conference center were everyone was roaming around in dress for the evening. We were in travel clothes and hauling a cooler around while kids were going to proms and gentlemen in formal kilts stood around. Then we couldn't find our way to the lobby. There were no signs. The kitchen help was very helpful. It would have been good if a luggage cart had been present at the back door. It was also a problem finding the car afterwards. Again no signs or directions. I felt like I shouldn't have been there. The visit was very nice after that. Our room was great even though it was a mountain view. Bathroom was wonderful and clean (the ceiling above the tub was discolored). The staff was very good and friendly. Supper was very good. I would recommend the French Onion Soup. The Sweet Shop is a great place. It was so much better than a Coffee Bar stuck in the corner and it was a place to get dessert after supper had settled. The Hotel was very comfortable and a pleasure to stay in. We didn't use the spa, the pool or the fitness room, but they looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The great, the good and the bad.”
Reviews.Author: Friscojill
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful and on top of a hill. Stayed 5 days Call ahead reservations: Went smoothly. Lauren and Jessica set up our rooms and they were very funny and helpful.They emailed everything to me. They told me all the things we should do and all the shows we should miss. I wish I could of met them while I was there to thank them in person. They were right on with their information. We arrived at about 1:30 p.m. and was greeted by Brodie the bellman. He opened the doors for us and asked us how we were doing and proceeded to the trunk of our car to get our luggage. He waited with us while we checked in. He did a great job and was very friendly. CHECK IN: We were warmly greeted with a great attitude and smile by Ashley V. She gave us all the info we needed and set us up to eat brunch at their restaurant. Even though we were coming in late the buffet was full and the food was WONDERFUL ($29.00 -Adult and $16.00 child). Everything you can think of they offered. It tasted fresh and was hot. It was worth the money. Our waiter was Ibo and he was very attentive, great to my two children and we never had a half empty glass. He was so kind to give us take out drinks for the room. ROOMS: We had 2 rooms that adjoined on the 8th floor. Both were Lakeview king and a double. We faced the parking lot (we requested this view because we did not want to hear the air units they have on the other side) with a 1/2 lake-1/2 tree view. Rooms were nice and clean and the beds okay......a little hard for my taste but had many pillows to choose from. As stated in other reviews there is no free internet in room. We did use their library for the free wi/fi and it was very comfortable(Took pillow and blanket with me). Did order in room internet for 2 of the 5 days we were there and it was only $10.00. Not too bad. SWEET SHOP: Had the BIGGEST sweet rolls and malts ever. They had a great selection of most things and the best part was little sweet Margaret. She was so kind and soft spoken. She made you feel like you were at Grandma's. Wanted to take her home with us. ROOM SERVICE: We ordered room service and it came in the time they said. We had Cammila and she was fantastic. She entered the room, was very friendly, she set up a table with a tablecloth, put out silverware, poured the water glasses, and served the food. It was hot and very tasty. INDOOR POOL: Nice but water was cloudy and had a strong smell of bleach. Kids loved it though. 3rd day there I heard a grandmother talking to her granddaughter on why she peed in the pool. Got the kids out and told the front desk asap. They sent someone to the pool within a sec to check the chemical levels and put more in. I appreciated the fast action on the part of the hotel to fix this. However, we did not swim the rest of our time there. (I'm OCD about germs) SPA: Nice but pricey. Staff was very friendly and did a great job. COMPLAINTS: 1ST. The restaurant does NOT like for YOU to get take out orders from them. Instead they want you to order room service. My 6 year old son just wanted a pizza to take with him because we were to eat at a fish place he does not like and they were flat rude about it. I asked them if this was a hotel "rule" and he said no but they "prefer" you to order from the room. I asked him what the difference was if I sat down ordered a pizza and asked for a to go box and he couldn't answer me instead he put in the order and we got the pizza to go. I know they want there 20% plus a tip they get from room service but give me a break. I'm not ordering take out for the whole family which by the way should be honored. My son just wanted to eat pizza on the way to the "yukky restaurant we picked to eat at. 2ND: The two live birds in the lobby. THEY ARE VERY VERY LOUD! They cover them at 10:00 p.m. and uncover them at 8:00 a.m. to feed them. They chirp very loudly for 2 1/2 hours and if you want to sleep late FORGET IT. I called down to the front desk and they give you a song and dance about how well they are taken care of and Mr. Hammons loved these birds and he felt they were a great thing to have in the lobby. blah, blah, blah. However, some of the staff did agreed with me and to tell you the truth it made me feel better that they actually felt the same. They are only LOUD in the morning until about 11.00 a.m. I personally told the highest person up I could talk to to put the LOUD birds in her office if she liked them so much. She didn't like that too well. Maybe she hates the birds too. Moving on...... CHECK OUT: Checked out over the T.V. . Left the card keys in the room and the bellman took our luggage down and we were off. Painless PARKING: Free and covered if you want to park a little ways out. Worth it if you have a black car and it gets hot. Well that's it. We had a lovely time and will return if the birds die or go away or if we have to get up early in the morning while there. Hope this helps. It was one of the nicest hotels there that we looked at hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Rooms Loud bird sound from atrium”
Reviews.Author: mkmFayetteville_AR
Reviews.Content: The Room is very pretty but loud! We stayed in the King Room with lakeview. The lakeview had a balcony that overlooked the mechanicals, air units and delivery. The lakeview was at an angle. Not what I expected when I requested something nice for our anniversary. The loud fake bird sound is very annoying in the atrium, it sounds loud in the room. Nice room service for breakfast. Bed was ok, not that soft. Spa is nice with sauna and steam room but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great...except....”
Reviews.Author: perfecto3612
Reviews.Content: We Checked in New years eve at the Chateau and were there for one night, and that is where our only issue lies. Jacob was our "host" during the check in process and he seemed bothered by the tedious task of his job. He seemed very distracted and inattentive. We were not dressed to the nines during check in. After all we drove 4 hours and had our comfy clothes on, maybe because of that he felt it unnecessary to check us in properly. We dont expect the red carpet treatment, but at least make eye contact and dont answer phone calls during this process. After that however, everything was up hill. An absolutley gorgeous facility. We ordered room service and the gentlemen that brought our food was great and very happy to be there. He even gave us some good tips on where to go in town. After a snack we chose to visit the Library Lounge and Stefani was our Hostess. What a great job she did. Very attentive and made us feel very welcome. Again someone who enjoyed what they were doing. The rooms were very well kept and the views are remarkable. Check out was simple and uneventful. All and all a great place to visit and stay. I guess at the end of the day maybe Jacob was just having a bad day...we all do now and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Nice”
Reviews.Author: Dodger32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau on Dec 31, 2010 and partook of the New Year’s Eve package. The Chateau was beautifully decorated and the room was very nice, but I do have some recommendations/complaints for you. My first complaint is that the menu for the New Year’s Eve package, when I looked at this online, said there would be Surf and Turf. What we received was Grilled Caesar Salad, which actually turned out to be a giant leaf with dressing, and a piece of steak (which they never asked how we like it cooked) and a little bit of crab meat on top of the steak along with what was described as (truffle whipped potatoes. The potatoes were not cooked and actually were the worst potatoes that I have ever had. I never saw dessert. They did not serve it our table. I have a problem with this because when I booked the package, I was thinking that Surf and Turf meant steak and Lobster. I was thoroughly disappointed. We paid almost $500.00 for a room and dinner that served a leaf and a small steak with a handful of chopped crab meat. My second complaint is that we book this package and can’t even access the swimming pool. How much extra do we have to pay to get in the swimming pool? Did we not pay enough? This was ridiculous. Needless to say we were quite disappointed that we spent $500.00 for one night and I feel like we only got half the worth of that. Also, we were told that there would be a Champagne brunch on New Year’s Day, but it was $40.00 per person. Why was this not included in the package? I feel like we were nickeled and dimed the entire stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend get away!”
Reviews.Author: crazyfatcat
Reviews.Content: I choose Chateau on the lake for my 10th wedding anniversary. I had read many of the reviews and felt confident that this was the hotel for us. All our expectations were met. Beautiful hotel with wonderful Christmas decor, clean rooms and friendly staff. I couldn't be happier to have spend four days at this wonderful hotel, and hope to go back next year. K. Franklin Missouri

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Delightful Experience at the Chateau on the Lake Resort”
Reviews.Author: UTRPh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Chateau on this, our first trip to Branson. I really wanted this trip to be special, so I picked the Chateau out of the many choices available because it looked like a beautiful place to stay that was away from the traffic yet within a short drive away the from shows and restaurants in Branson. I chose a lakefront room to have the best view available. The Chateau was the perfect choice for our Branson getaway. This majestic hotel is perfectly located on a hilltop that overlooks a beautiful, pristine lake. The hotel was decorated for Christmas and featured several gingerbread houses that were delightful. A manger scene was situated at the head of a beautiful indoor waterfall. A whimsical Santa was found climbing down a rope from the 10 story atrium. What a wonderful, delightful experience we had while staying at the Chateau! Upon first driving up to the Chateau, we found the bell staff to be very helpful and friendly. When we checked in, we were initially offered a room on the 3rd floor. I had previously read that the 3rd floor was where pets were allowed. My wife is allergic to cats, so I asked for a different room. A short time later, we were given a room on the 8th floor. I don’t travel that much, but I thought the room was absolutely perfect. It had a balcony with 2 chairs so that we could sit and enjoy a magnificent view of the lake. The king sized bed was absolutely comfortable. There were 2 sink areas: one in the bedroom, which my wife used as a dressing area, and one in the bathroom. Both sink areas were long and roomy. The room and the hotel were not only clean, but amazingly spotless. The staff truly went way out their way to be helpful and friendly. We ate 2 meals at the Chateau. We ate dinner at the Chateau Grille and breakfast at the Atrium Café. For dinner at the Grille, I had the Texas fried steak, which was served hot and tasty. In both instances, we had a delightful waitress by the name of Amber. While ordering breakfast at the Atrium Café, my wife was really in the mood for hot chocolate. However, she has lactose intolerance and would be unable to consume the hot chocolate that was on the menu. When we mentioned this to Amber, she went way out of her way and found soy milk and had the hot chocolate made for my wife that she could enjoy. Amber’s demeanor was so sweet and friendly; she made an impression on us that we will not forget. Yvonne at the Concierge desk was also very friendly and helpful. We had some time available for a show and she was able to print up a list of shows that were still available, even though it was getting close to the last minute. She called for us and made reservations for the show, which was so nice. After our delightful experience, I would unequivocally recommend the Chateau for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Chateau on the Lake Resort is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: BigBroChuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Chateau on the Lake Resort while we were in Branson for the Lifeway Festival of Marriage conference! The conference was held there at the resort. It was an AMAZING conference! THe rooms were amazing! This was like one of the resorts that we've stayed at in either Mexico or the Carribean. The beds were very comfortable! Rooms were clean! The service was OUTSTANDING! The front counter service was good but the housekeepers were exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. I LOVED how they the resort had everything all decorated for Christmas! The view from our room was AMAZING! THe resort was overlooking the lake on one side and overlooking Ozark Mountains on the other side. In the morning when we woke up there was fog/steam coming off the lake and then the sunrise - one of the most beautiful sunrises I've EVER seen! It's fall too so the colors of the trees in the Ozark Mountains made the scenery gorgeous! Can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room accomodations let down a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 22club58
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in a Lakefront Ambassador King room – a one bedroom suite. The Suite was well sized except for the bathroom, which for the class of hotel was one of the smallest hotel bathrooms I have seen – more akin to a budget property. There was only one sink, no makeup area for my wife and no seperate lavatory. The lake view was there but from the balcony any view to the left was blocked by an abutting wall – not at all the broad expansive view that one would have expected. On the other hand, all the staff were extremely helpful - especially in the Library Lounge where we ate a late supper at the bar on most nights and the food was good. Service in the Sweet Shoppe for breakfast to go was unbelievably slow and disorganized. Valet parking at $14 is no bargain. On balance, the hotel accommodations were not of the standard we anticipated nor, for the Midwest, matching the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: My husand and I decided to splurge and spent our 23 anniversary at Chateau on the Lake, We checked in on a Saturday afternoon and stayed 2 nights. We arrived at approx. 430 and our room wasn't ready, they offered coupons for the Sweet Shoppe and said they would come get us when it was ready. We where in our room less than 10 minutes later. The hotel gave us a fridge for our room at no cost which I was surprised that a hotel that charges what they do the fridge isn't standard. The doormen where very friendly and helpful along with the checkin clerk. The hotel itself is beautiful. We rode our motorcycle down and the doormen where extremely helpful taking our luggage up so we could park the bike since valet wasn't an option. We walked into our room and we where both pleased, we where on the 7th floor with a baloncy that had a view of the lake, beautiful. Room was very spacious and nicely decorated. The bathroom very large and well appointed. We decided to visit the Library Lounge and once again the view is spectacular. Service and drinks both good. Something to remember if you would like a taxi plan 1-2 hours wait The first evening we ate decided to eat at the hotel and decided to go with the fine dining option, they only had approx. 6 tables full and service just wasn't very good, while the waiter was friendly service was very slow, water and ice tea where not refilled without a request. The food was good but not something I would probably go back for. Sunday we got a late start on the day, the bed was so comfortable I didn't want to get out of it, but we did leave the hotel at about 10 30 in the morning for sight seeing. When we came back to the hotel we decided we would have a drink at the lounge and watch the sunset, much to our surprise the Lounge was closed with a sign saying the Atrium Bar was open, we walked over there and discovered another couple that had been waiting for over 20 minutes and had seen no one. Finally a girl came up and said maybe I can help you but I'm not a bartendar, the first drink that was order she couldn't make so she went in search of a bartendar, instead the chef came and attempted to make drinks. We decided at that point we would dress for dinner and head back to town. When arriving back to the hotel we though we would utilize the 24 hour indoor pool, this was the second surprise the pool closes at 10 pm on Sunday once again a little disappointed that the amenities advertised were not available. Chateau on the Lake is a beautiful property that has a lot of potentional, while most expectations where meet some aspects of service where definatley lacking. I don't mind paying more but what like to recieve the services advertised. I would probably go back for a special occasion but would not make this a normal stop, things just where not consistant enough,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but Far from Attractions”
Reviews.Author: loimln
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a recent business trip to attend a convention that was being held at the hotel. The hotel is beautiful and very well-kept. Located up high on the hill, it offers some beautiful scenery around the lake. My room was spacious, quiet and cozy. The courtesy van drivers that brought us to and from the Branson airport were prompt and provided great information about the area. The bartender and front door staff were always very kind and helpful. Front-desk staff moved a little slow and it took some time to get checked in. The restaurants were good but very pricey. Unfortunately, this hotel is very far from everything. We did not rent a car (due to company expense limitations) and had to rely on a taxi to get anywhere off the hotel property. Taxi fares averaged $12-$20 (not including tip) each way whenever we wanted to go somewhere. The hotel shuttle did not offer transportation to shows or any other area attractions. I wish I had time to experience the spa because I heard some wonderful things. Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful service!- Awesome sunsets”
Reviews.Author: buckieAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chateau on the Lake for a conference last week. This is a beautiful hotel overlooking the lake. When we checked in there were no rooms left that overlooked the lake, but when we got to our room, the smell was very musty and smokie (even though it is a smoke free hotel) and the view was of the air-conditioning units. My husband has ashmna so we called down to the front desk and they did switch us immediately to a room that overlooked the lake! They were so kind to do this. The rooms are very large and the bathroom had a huge countertop, plus there is an extra sink in the bedroom area which was nice. Beds were VERY comfortable . There are 3 places to get food in the hotel and the food was good. (a fine dining, a cafe, and a dei and ice cream shop) Be sure to eat a nice meal on the patio overlooking the lake. The sunsets are amazing!!! The waitress staff was so friendly too and always tried to get us a good seat to see the sunset. We ordered the steak and salmon one night and it was some ot the best I've ever had. For breakfast, you might as well order the buffet because by the time you order a separate entree , coffee and juice, it is the same amout as the buffet. There are no other close restaurants around unless you have a rental car and can go into Branson city which is about a 15 min ride. I did take advantage of the pool and the spa one day. VERY nice so don't miss out on this if you have time. The outdoor pool is lovely and overlooks the lake so you have a great view. On another note, if you go into Branson for a show, (that is really all there is to do there!)get a map and take the side roads as the traffic on the main street is so backed up. (the orange, red and green lines work best) We saw the "12 Irish Tenors" and they were fabulous! There are not many wonderful restaurants in Branson,(Mostly chain food) so we were happy to eat at the Chateau on the Lake where it is much more peaceful and away from all the crowds and traffic. We are from Atlanta so we loved flying in and out of the new airport in Branson. It is so small, but like a one room lodge! LOVE IT! The only place to get food in there is Famous Dave's BBQ which is good. It is a beautiful drive from the airport which sits on top of a mountain, beside 2 golf courses!!! All in all, our stay in Branson was very nice - just be prepared for all the tour buses and senior citizens - but we loved talking to them... Hey...that will be us one day!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo_Lago
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the Chateau is quite lovely. Once inside, things change. The lobby and public areas are beginning to show their age. We stayed in 2 different rooms and each was just short of being shabby. Furnishings were worn, bathrooms were not quite clean, shower curtains were mildewed, caulk was missing around tubs and, surprise, there are no exhaust fans in the bathrooms, making for very humid conditions after a shower. During a rainstorm, the french doors leaked a significant amount of water into the rooms. Additionally, the skylights in the 10-story atrium leaked and first floor ceilings also were leaking. Service was, at best, spotty. People at the front desk seemed to be disinterested. The manager was surprised to hear that our bathrooms had no exhaust fans and said that all bathrooms had exhausts. After checking with a dozen other guests, we learned that none of the rooms had exhaust fans. Prices in the restaurants were high and service was slow. It took 10 minutes to get a cup of coffeein the "Sweet Shop"--there were only two people ahead of me the person at the counter seemed overwhelmed. The Chateau may be a 4 or 5 star hotel by Branson standards, but not by mine. Overall, the experience was little better than staying in a cut-rate, chain motel. Edit - Delete

Reviews.Title: “If in doubt on where to stay in Branson... just stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: cjrdh13
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we stayed in the Best Western the first 2 nights we were in Branson, then we splurged and got the Bed & Breakfast package at the Chateau on the Lake for the last night. Of course, Chateau on the Lake was beautiful, beautiful gardens inside the hotel itself and a wonderful view of the lake. Amenities were wonderful and top of the line. Somebody has posted something on here about tipping. Well, when we pulled up at the resort, one of the men was wanting to take our luggage, but they do give you the option. You don't have to have the bellboy bring up your luggage... that is just a convenience for you and if you want it then yes, you do need to tip. You can just say NO, if you don't want them to do it for you. The breakfast package does not necessarily mean you have to use it for breakfast. You get a $40 food credit- you can choose to use it at the Grille, room service, the Atrium, or Sweet Shoppe. We had the breakfast and then had a little left over for using at the sweet shoppe. To sum it up, the next time we come to branson, we will be staying at the Chateu on the Lake for all the nights we're there. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.!:)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional potential, average attitude.”
Reviews.Author: UncommonSmith
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked a Spa getaway on a weekday. I was amazed at how this hotel had such classy potential then, as other have said, either cut corners on quality or nickel and dimed at every chance. We were staying the night prior to a day of spa treatments and I asked for late check out after our treatments, I was told twice that they couldn't even give me an answer. No fridge in the rooms. Powdered eggs and other Sam's Club type food on the buffet. Average food offered on room service at 4 star resort prices, then gratuity, tax and delivery charges added to the point of ridiculous! $10 a day for internet. The spa staff excellent however, charges posted in brochure don't include 20% additional charge for each treatment. I was told that was for the use of the facilities. Ok, but multiplied by each treatment? Being scheduled for several treatments I didn't have time to use the sauna etc. Yet I was charged 4 times for it.Gratuity. I was under the impression that was given per service as the guest felt was earned. At other fine resorts the charge was at the guests discretion. I am a regular Spa guest all over this country I was very surprised by the lack of class that peppered this potentially fine hotel. resort Spa client all over this country and the prices DO NOT line up to the level of service and quality I have experienced elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The most spectacular view!”
Reviews.Author: donnasmail84
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Chateau on the Lake was majestic! It is perfect for a Girl's Weekend! You must spend the day at the Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Branson trip”
Reviews.Author: schonvav
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, and the Spa was wonderful! Approximately 10 minutes away from everything, but a curvy drive up and down mountain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but inconsistent quality”
Reviews.Author: ozarkhighlands
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Chateau, we were there with friends and co-workers. We loved the amenities, decor and feel of the resort. The staff were very courteous and friendly. We had a buffet dinner/breakfast that was very good. That said there were some things that really surprised me. The rooms themselves were ok, but quite frankly I've stayed at Holiday Inns that were just as nice. There was definately a issue with the air conditioning in a couple of our rooms. When we checked in the room was set around 74 I think and it was quite warm. We thought ok it is very hot so we'll kick the a/c down to 64 and when we come back in a few hours it'll be cooler but that didn't happen. It never did cool down properly even when we set the thermostat to 60 and left for part of the day. We travel with a fan and that was pretty much the only reason we were able to stay somewhat comfortable. I think the biggest surprise to us was the lack of a refrigerator in the room. A room that cost 200 and up and there's not a fridge? I was also surprised at how thin the insulation was. Anytime the people in the room next to us made any noise (normal noise) we could hear it. Should we really be able to hear them in the bathroom? I wouldn't discourage someone from staying at the Chateau, but I don't know that I would recommend it over other hotels/resorts. I think this place could be alot more value for the cost of staying there if a few changes were made. In reading other reviews I see some of the same experiences mentioned and I have to wonder why the owners/managers aren't correcting what appears to me to be something fairly easy to fix.

Reviews.Title: “All you need in one”
Reviews.Author: MARCHER
Reviews.Content: Everything about the resort was perfect! What a beautiful lake!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT THE CHATEAU”
Reviews.Author: cat7847
Reviews.Content: After checking out numerous hotel sites on the internet we decided to stay at the Chateau on the Lake in July of 2010. The hotel is located away from the commercial/retail areas of Branson and very near a state park and beach area. Also close to a fish hatchery. We loved the location as it was on top of a hill and the view of the lake was wonderful. If we wanted to go see a show it was just a short 5 to 10 minute drive back to the hustle and bustle of Branson. We opted for a mountain side view to save some money and our room was very spacious and beautiful. We had a king size bed and it was very comfortable. The birds go to bed around 10:00 or 11:00 so if you want to go to bed before that time you will hear them. This is a pet friendly hotel which is nice. I have never found animals to be a problem. The pool was spacious and there is a great view of the lake from the pool area as well. The hotel offers a free movie each night in the lower level theatre, a kids club, paddle boats, canoes and kayaks free of charge. A mulitude of other boats, and jet ski's are available for rental. I'ts best to drive to the lake/marina as Branson is all hills so driving is a little easier. The lake is very clean and clear. All in all I enjoyed my stay very much and hope to return if I visit the area again. Items that could be improved upon would be a small fridge in all rooms. Some folks must take medicine that has to stay refrigerated or like to have cold water available at night so the fridge would come in handy. It would be wonderful if the hotel put in an actual sand beach area. The lake is so great it's a shame there is no where on the property to actually swim in the lake. There is a beach about 1 miles from the property at a state park but having a beach on the property would be great. One evening during our stay storms rolled through the area. I was very glad I had used the underground parking that is available and that I was staying in such a well constructed hotel and not the one of the lesser constructed hotels downtown. All in all I really had a pleasant stay and would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcofer84
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Chateau. Everything was very nice about this hotel. It is away from the traffic of the strip, the staff was very nice and the amenities are top notch. The only two things that I did not like about this was being woke up every morning by the parakeets in the atrium/lobby and the directions to the hotel listed on their website. If you are coming from Springfield, MO, do not take the directions that they suggest. Take the Hwy 248 which turns into Gretna Road all the way to the Hotel. You go through the strip, but just the interesection of HWY 76. The conceierge was very helpful finding different things around Branson and provided a great map of the roads around the city. We really enjoyed eating lunch by the pool....a little pricey but that is what you expect from a luxury hotel. If you have kids this is a great place. The grill by the pool offers boxed lunches for a charge, but saw lots of kids eating these. Would suggest that the hotel offer mini-refrigerators for its guests. We ended up going to Walmart and buying a styrofome cooler to keep our sodas and alcohol and snacks cool. Saved us money too. This is a great place for conferences and conventions. They have a nice marina on the grounds, but it is a steep walk so would suggest driving, especially in July. The hotel is located near a state fishery and the dam. This is nice to take kids to see. The hotel offers a lot of for kids and adults.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: stooges
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at Chateau on the Lake as we gathered for a family reunion and this hotel proved to be a great place for the reunion. The nicest features we found were that there were so many activities --use of kayaks, paddleboats, canoes, indoor and outdoor pools, very close to Moonshine Beach, many activities for young children, and great areas for just sitting and visiting and enjoying the beautiful views of Table Rock Lake. The hotel was very clean and everyone that we dealt with from the staff at the front door to the ladies at the reception desk to the ladies in the Sweet Shoppe were very kind and courteous. I didn't personally eat a meal at the restaurant, but did have a couple of different items from the Sweet Shoppe (pecan roll & cheesecake), and they were wonderful. I only gave four stars to sleep quality because the beds are double-sized and we're used to a queen-sized bed, and four stars for "Rooms" because we had one of the few rooms in the hotel that overlooked the rooftop with the airconditioning units on it - so the view was not good at all. Overall though, a great experience and I would definitely recommend and plan to return on another trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “So Much Nice, But not there yet.”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaCityBozo
Reviews.Content: We started our visit in the spa. Wonderful couples massage plan, every couple should sign up. Our room had a beautiful view of the lake, and even in November it was a worth the price difference to have such a room. Like so many other guests we were real surprised to find the room did not have a refrig and microwave. Even Hilton Garden Inns and Marriott Courtyard Inns have these and they are not resort. As traveliers you think as you move up the chain you will have what you had at the lower level plus... Not in this case. We stay in the above on business trips and higher end resport hotels on holiday. This is the first high end without these features automaticly in the rooms. (enough ont that, but it was our biggest disappointment). Each morning we worked out in the excercise room, again the view of the lake was great. Ate one meal there, value was missing (taste + quantity didn't = price). Would as management when they respond to respond directly to the issue of room appliances. I am preparing to book again for this next fall. Hope to find refrig and microwaves.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: simpwholegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is the best place in Branson! My husband and I are very fussy about hotels, and have no problem admitting that. We would not visit a place unless there is a very nice hotel or resort to stay in, and this place fit the bill! The management is topnotch, the service is excellent, the facilities are clean as can be, and the amentities are all there!! We visited the spa two days while we were there and although the relaxation rooms can use some work, the rest of the spa is very nice! The retail part of the spa could use more products, and perhaps some apparel, but my therapist, Andrea, was very accomodating and well trained. I appreciated her attention to my individual needs. My husband said he had the best massage he's ever had there and he gets regular monthly massages, so that is saying alot! The food was all wonderful, the library lounge was relaxing after an evening out and the bartender, Dominique and the cocktail watiress (?) were absolutely perfect! The hotel is kept very clean and attention to details were noticed, our only complaint was that we could never enjoy the outdoor deck the whole time we were there because smokers were everywhere and this got very annoying trying to find a place to sit outside and enjoy the lake. I also want to make a special note about the manager of this hotel. He went out of his way to help us when we had car trouble, and never once made us feel like we were any trouble at all. He is a special manager with qualities that show in the way his hotel looks and feels, as well as the way he treats his guests! We will definitley return soon,as well as suggest this very nice hotel to all of our friends who enjoy "nice" accomodations!

Reviews.Title: “The Chateau could be so much more.”
Reviews.Author: scrall1
Reviews.Content: Just seemed like we were being nickeled and dimmed. When you start out paying $250 a night, you expect a few things. A fridge in the room. And not being asked to pay $20 per day for it. No internet. etc. This place could be so much more if a little effort was taken in the customer service area.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is very nice. However I feel...”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel19
Reviews.Content: This resort is very nice. However I feel compelled to write a realistic review so traveler know what to expect. Chateau grille: overpriced. My salad was twelve dollars and not very big. It was yummy but too pricey for what you get. For three of uS it was thirty two dollars for a light lunch, including one kids meal. Breakfast in bed: really overpriced. You pay 20 extra to get a forty dollar credit and after gratuity and delivery fee it cost me around fourty dollars. It was yummy as well, just feel nickle and dimed. Checkin: I called ahead to checkin early. They said to come on and hopefully it wil be ready by my arrival time. 4pm is a very late time as is, but it wasn't ready and the lady at the desk wasn't helpful. She told me to wonder around and she'd call when ready. Did she call. No. Finally around three we went back and a room was ready. The beds are not comftorable and pillows are hard as a rock. Other than that, it is a very nice place with great overall service. No place is perfect, which is why I want to be honest. I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortably Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Nacholovers
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow travelers! First of all, this hotel and spa is probably one of the best hidden gems in the state of Missouri. Roughly a 3 1/2 hour drive from the outskirts of St. Louis, Chateau on the Lake offers a secluded getaway that is often impossible to find in the Midwest. The location is great, although a little tricky to get to if you are not used to a rolling and hilly terrain. The seclusion is nice, but can be intimidating if it is your first time in the Branson area. For my wife and I, we took it all in stride as it was a getaway for our sixth anniversary. Booked online at the beginning of May, we were absolutely stunned at the bargain and availability we were able to get so close to our travel date. We thought for sure the hotel would either be fully booked or prices would be outrageous. Kudos to hotel management for keeping the prices reasonable during this economic slowdown. The room we were blessed with could have easily gone for twice as much here in the city. Now, the reason for the title. Despite having great amenities, a fabulous location, delicious food, and a spectacular spa, I feel all of that was undercut by a sense of nervousness from some of the staff and guests. Having a different ethnic background from most of the people in the area seemed to catch a lot of people off guard. Let me be clear. No one said or did anything offensive at all; however, there were a few awkward stares from other guests and a few interactions with one or two members of the hotel staff that were less than desirable. Overall, this did not affect our entire opinion of the hotel, only to say that for the facility to have people of other ethnic backgrounds working on staff, it is quite surprising how uninviting cultural diversity was during the time of our stay. So that was the uncomfortable part, the satisfactory came from the great lakeview room which was large enough for four guests and the spa experience which made the entire weekend a success. The room was very comfortable and exceeded our expectations. You never know what you are going to get when you look at the web photos of a hotel room before your stay. Room service was timely and the food was better than expected. With such a wide variety of treats throughout the entire hotel (the candy shop and deli downstairs included) it was very hard to go hungry. The movie theater and cafe were also a nice touch. Management has gone out of their way to ensure guests never have to leave the property. The spa was an unexpected bonus. We knew there was a spa before we arrived, but we weren't sure if it was going to be available or priced reasonably. To our surprise, it was both. My wife and I were able to book a last minute service and we took full advantage of having access to all of the amenities such as the sauna, steam shower, and hot tub. Our goal was to have a lazy anniversary weekend where we could escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life, yet spoil ourselves with the amenities we are used to at home. Chateau on the Lake was able to accommodate our wishes and for that, we are thankful. We will recommend this resort to our friends, but we encourage management to continue to improve diversity training among the staff members. We have a large network of friends in the Midwest, most of them from all types of ethnic backgrounds. We would love to have them include this resort on their list of 'must do' for Missouri.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Lacks Room Amenities and Complimentary Services”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdviceFrom
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. I could not comment on the sleep quality as we haven't actually spent the night yet, since we just checked in today. The room decor is above average in style and furnishings; however, for being in an entertainment area where even the most mediocre of hotels offer a minifridge and microwave in each room, I was astounded to find that these amenities were replaced only with a hamper in the bathroom to hold dirty, wet towels. Thumbs down for that one! This hotel also does not offer a complimentary breakfast which is a first rate service in many other standard hotels in the area. Chatueau on the Lake and the Marriott Corporation need to be more service oriented to get my repeat business. We also arrived for a 3 night stay on a low occupancy weekend. I inquired at the reservations desk as to what their occupancy rate was this weekend and was told that occupancy was at 30%. We were assigned a room furthest from the elevator overlooking a rooftop...another thumbs down for this hotel, particularly, when our reservation was made weeks in advance and occupancy was at such a low rate. An upgrade was not even offered. The grounds of the hotel are outstanding and meticulously groomed. Lawns are well manicured, flowerbeds are weed free and grounds landscaped with beautiful streams & waterfalls. Architecture, curb appeal and appearance of the hotel are deserving of a thumbs up. My overall assessment... I am at a hotel for MY convenience; and I am looking for amenities and services which meet MY needs. I would summarize by saying that this hotel is good, but there is room for improvement in complimentary services and amenities. Would I stay, again? Probably not. Would I recommend it to a friend? Perhaps what they are looking for in a hotel is different than what I look for in a hotel; but I am going to say no, that I would not recommend it conditioned on my own epxerience and expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Branson”
Reviews.Author: TeresaHouston
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week of April in lake view ambassador suite on 10th floor with incredible views of Table Rock Lake. Hotel grounds were manicured, lobby & atrium is beautiful & well-kept, indoor & outdoor pools & playgrounds are clean & looked like new. The hotel service was wonderful - everyone there seemed genuinely glad we were there to spend our vacation. Check in was quick & easy, housekeeping was very responsive to our requests for extra blankets/soaps/glasses/coffees/etc, maintenance was busy checking out all the elevators, security & safety systems in prep for the busy season, workers were busy with outdoor pool prep. The concierge Angel obtained all our tickets, was very helpful with show recommendations. The spa was very relaxing & quite luxurious - we used the spa 3 days in a row, had excellent service & greatly enjoyed ammenities each time. The Chateau Grill served excellent food for a reasonable price, although the service could have been slightly better in there. The Sweet Shop was so convenient & offered tempting desserts & coffees & ice creams. The outdoor patios were inviting with dozens of dining tables, chairs & rockers. I regret we never had a drink in the Lounge, although it was beautifully furnished for relaxing in large chairs & loungers, with a fire going in the lovely fireplace every evening. The food & wine festival was enjoyable, & they only charged us a deeply discounted cover charge since we arrived only in time to attend the final hour. We didn't have kids with us, so we didn't need use of the kids theater or the kids club called Crawdaddies. Hotel was on top of a hill right on the lake, just a couple minutes outside the crowds of Branson. Everyone had a fabulous time at this hotel - can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind in Branson”
Reviews.Author: interviewtraveler
Reviews.Content: Chateau on the Lake is designed similar to the Embassy Suites chain, but it is distinct in Branson because of the great service and the isolation from the typical Branson stuff. The service is very good literally from the moment you walk in the door, and the rooms are nice sized. Even our regular room had a nice balcony where you could get fresh air and see the lake from afar. I liked that there was a sink in the bathroom and in the room as well. The only minor glitch was with the finicky tub/shower faucet, but overall the bathroom was quite satisfactory. The gym is small but packed with weights and aerobic machines. There are a whole lot of amenities that the hotel offers, and the food I had there was delicious. However, it can get pricey especially since there really isn't anywhere walkable or within quick driving distance. Ultimately, I had a lovely stay and would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: HarleyMomma1992
Reviews.Content: Stayed at COTLR with my Mom & daughter for a dance competition and class. We had no idea how pleasantly surprised we were about to be. This hotel is so beautiful, rooms are SO CLEAN (I am a germ freak too), the best part was that our room had 2, yes 2 vanities...a girls dream. The staff was AWESOME, friendly, greeted you on arrival. Restaurants were excellent and so professional. I can't say enough good things about it. You have got to see for yourself. You children will LOVE the lobby. Lots of great photo ops too! Kids will love the movie theater and pools. Just a lovely place. OH and we had a standard room reserved, got there and they upgraded us without even charging us more, we got the lake view balcony for the same low price.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect - one of our top 5 stays!”
Reviews.Author: 5genoklahoman
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Branson, and this hotel is perfect in ALMOST every way. Our Ambassador suite was simply the best laid-out floor plan of any hotel room we've ever stayed in. The housekeeping staff was some of the best I have ever seen, and restaurant on site was THE best in all of Branson. Period! They have a real movie theater that seats about 50 on the premises with free movies showing twice a day. The indoor pool was well kept, and I assume the very large outdoor pool would be the same in-season. The hotel management was first class (thanks Eric!) What wasn't perfect? This hotel is obviously being micro-managed from corporate headquarters - and that's a shame because they have great people on site. Little things turned into big annoying things when everything else was *so* perfect: no stationary bikes in the fitness center, luggage carts are not available to guests, LCD TVs with all kinds of great features are disabled and "locked" to the old-fashioned hotel-style SD stations. The iBahn-operated wireless Internet was as terrible here as it is everywhere else we've stayed. We ran into 1 waitress and 2 or 3 front desk clerks that were low quality - slow, undertrained, and passing-the-buck instead of fixing the problem. If you can spot those people and avoid them, you will love the people and service at the Chateau. If you are travelling to Branson and are not the "log cabin" type, THIS is your home away from home! We will very likley return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: BransonBroncofan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended a large banquet and stayed the night to celebrate our anniversary. The banquet staff served over 800 guests and the service was flawless, the food was delicious and hot, and didn't ever have to ask for anything. The staff is obviously professional and very well trained. Our room was spotless, and the Champagne was delivered precisely on time. All in all, this will be one anniversary that we will remember as the most special we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, not so lovely service”
Reviews.Author: Jenerator325
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the "off-season" for the area just for a weekend getaway. Let me begin by saying that the hotel itself is wonderful, it is a lovely place. The room was nicely appointed and we had no trouble checking in. The only issue we ran into was with the dining options. When we checked in we were given a weekly newsletter for the property. We arrived around 930 pm and were a little hungry. According to the paper we were handed the only option open to us was room service. We called the room service number and no one answered. We called the front desk and asked them about it. We were informed that all dining options closed by 9 and that our best bet was Domino's. We reminded her that the newsletter stated that room service was available until 11pm. It was about this time I realized that the newsletter was from January 2009, a whole year old. They basically told us we were out of luck. I was really bothered by the fact that the newsletter they were giving out was full of incorrect info, what is the point of that. It only makes the staff look lazy or the hotel look like it doesn't do much business at all. The following day we saw a sign in the lobby for high tea. We thought it would be a fun thing to do that afternoon so we set up a time. The tea itself was fine, and the waiter who waited on us was pleasant and pretty attentive. As we were finishing the other waiters were getting ready for dinner service and were chatting. They were going on and on about how crappy the groups were that they were assigned for the evening. I thought that was extremely rude, especially as there were customers not 15 feet away. We decided then and there we were done eating at the hotel. The bright spots were definitely the doormen and the maid service. The room was spotless everyday and the maid was very nice. The doormen were kind and struck up conversation with us as we came and went. I would perhaps recommend this hotel if you're just going for a nice place to stay. It is beautiful. I would however just advise people to not expect much in the way of service or kindness from some of the staff. The hotel sells itself as a very upscale place, and they just need a little revamping of the customer service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property, but in need of a head waiter and some customer service training”
Reviews.Author: tl704
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property over Thanksgiving this year and were pleased overall with the property, but found the service to be incredibly lacking. We drove from Dallas and ended up arriving after midnight. When we went in, we were immediately impressed with the Christmas decorations and initial presentation. We waited for about 5-6 minutes for someone to show up so we could check in. As I was about to go looking for someone, the Security Manager came by and went and got the front desk clerk for us. During the stay the Security Manager proved to be the most knowledgeable, helpful and genuinely concerned for guest services individual we encountered. The lobby of the hotel was very nice, but the overall hotel is basically the cookie cutter design for Embassy Suites although they tout it as being architecturally significant. We were checked in, and the Security Manager took our bags to the room. The room was nicely decorated, but not anything extraordinary by any means. Throughout the booking process I was under the impression the I was booking a suite only to discover that we had been booked into a King room. The next morning I asked about moving to a suite and paying the additional charges. The person at the front desk said that he would check and get in touch with me about availability. Evidentially there were none available since I never did hear back from anyone. That morning we also decided to eat breakfast in the hotel. If you stay at this property DO NOT DO THIS! This property in is desperate need of a head waiter and some wait staff training. There were maybe 5-6 tables of people in the dining room and what appeared to be 2 waiters and a manager. We ordered a very simple breakfast which took over an hour to be delivered. With a 6 year and a 3 year old that is a long time to wait for eggs and pancakes. We noticed that we were served ahead of a few tables that ordered before us and that two tables that arrived after us were served first. When our food did finally arrive one order was stone cold. After about 5 minutes, I had to seek out the waiter to get it remade. It seemed that the wait staff throughout our stay were simply thrown into these jobs without any training at all. The service at a very basic casual dining restaurant is head and shoulders above what this property provides. We went to the concierge to arrange for the show tickets and tickets to Silver Dollar City. She had no record of us and we had to spend over and hour with her just trying to get this together.
