The concierge here is also evidentially not trained in any way. I booked the trip about 3 weeks in advance and had placed 7 calls to the concierge during this time, which all went unanswered. After leaving messages on probably 5 occasions I finally received a return call about 4 hours prior to our scheduled arrival time. I was not able to answer the call since I was driving through the mountains en route to the hotel, but returned the call within 5 minutes only to get voicemail again. I left another message, but no return call. When we were trying to get all the tickets arranged it was clear that the concierge was frazzled, callous and simply just trying to get us out of there. I have had better service in a crowded deli. This is were tripadvisor again proved invaluable by helping to arrange the activities for our stay. The other issues with the service were mainly with in room dinning. They close their restaurants and bars really early but say that room service is available. The first night we ordered from room service. Again, a very basic order, some sandwiches and a cobb salad. When the food arrived the cobb salad was just lettuce in bowl. I am really not exaggerating this in any way. It was lettuce in a bowl, for which we were charged $16.00. I called back to room service to find out what that was all about. The woman who answered said that with the changes we wanted made to the salad that is what the cook prepared. When I told her that it was a bowl of lettuce and asked if she really thought that was what we wanted, she would only answer (very rudely I might add) that was what we ordered. Since it was late and I was no mood to deal with her, I simply told her I would take it up with the GM in the morning. Much to my surprise, the night manager called back and removed it from the bill. When the food was delivered to the room the delivery person made it a point to say that the total and line for gratuity were on the tab. Since he went out his way to point this out my assumption was that it was not included, which I saw later was not the case. I don't begrudge anyone a gratuity for doing their job, and after waiting tables myself for many years go out of my way to make sure they are tipped properly, but come on. This was something that occurred throughout the stay with the wait staff. The only training they get must be on how to maximize every chance to make an extra buck. With the wait staff being trained to gouge, the housekeeping staff seemed to be the opposite. Each morning our room was made up perfectly. However, each time a new person would make up the room they would leave their gratuity on the bureau. I certainly appreciate the honesty of the staff, but I would suggest that the hotel go over some protocols that I thought was generally accepted with the staff. I mention that simply to make the point that the hotel needs to do a much better job of training and not to fault the house keeping staff in any way. They were some of the best I have ever encountered. We had Thanksgiving dinner at the hotel, which kept with the hotels "MO"; wonderful food, great ambiance and bad service. Again a total lack of wait staff training came into play. We were seated and someone took our drink order. A different person brought them back and said he would be our waiter. We went through the different carving stations and when we returned to the table the waiter told me that he was going to leave our bill since they were booked solid and they would need our table quickly. I was ready to give the bill back to him and tell him that we would leave when we were good and @#!% ready, but decided simply to keep giving it back to him whenever we added something just to make a point. We had the same early closing issues with the bar and restaurant the next night. There were quite a few guests in the bar, but when I went in it looked liked it was closed and that these we people who had been in there for a while. I saw the bartender at the end of the bar counting the money, but when I asked him if they were still open he just held up a finger and said "give me a minute". I went to the front desk and asked about the hours. The woman there said the bar was closed but that I could still order from room service. This was about exactly the same time we ordered as the previous night, but this time the same woman who had answered the call the night before refused to allow us to order beer and wine since the bar had already been “totaled up”, whatever that means. At the markup being charged for beer and wine one would think that they would take a few extra steps and go and get a bottle from the wine cellar. Lastly, when the bill arrived in our room the day we were to check out it was about as convoluted as it could be. They had randomly deducted random amounts from different charges to give us the package incentives. I had to go down to the front desk and have the Assistant Manager go through these with me. He was nice enough about it, but one would think that they would simply show you all the charges incurred and then the amount deducted for the total. It made it seem like they were trying to get away with something. Overall, I would reluctantly recommend this hotel because of the property. It is a very nice location, it is beautifully decorated for Christmas, it has great amenities and the food is excellent. It is apparent though that they market themselves as a 4 Diamond Hotel since the AAA Diamond rating system evaluates services offered, and not the way in which the services are rendered. After staying in a 5 Diamond property, the difference is exponential. I would add that the doorpersons are very friendly and helpful. If you stay at this property and need anything ask one of them! If you are looking for pleasant getaway with the family, this is an ideal spot, just go in with no expectations as to guest service and you will probably not be as disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and perfect for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: nibblet1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all decorated for Christmas and the atrium was a wonder. The concierge was super and got us tickets to shows with great seats and good prices. We stayed in the Ambassador room, which was a very large suite. The Mountain View was OK. We stayed on the 4th floor, I'd ask for something higher up to get an even better view.

Reviews.Title: “This was my first visit and it won't be my last!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 5ndacure
Reviews.Content: I had the best time! We ordered room service for practically every meal. Once we did our shopping, we were pooped! Curb service was excellent. Valet was great. This is the first time in a long time of traveling, that I can say everything was 100%. I booked with Hotels.com and saved a bundle. It was almost half price. Thanks again for the wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just make sure you're not on the dog floor, unless you want to be”
Reviews.Author: Nwash
Reviews.Content: My biggest compliant with Chateau is we were placed on floor 3. My dad found partially eaten dog food on the carpet in his room. He, as all of us, were disgusted and immediately told the front desk who responded, "Of course, it's the dog floor." Like we should have known. We didn't say were were traveling with pets, why would they put us on a disgusting floor? Also, there is still no excuse for not properly cleaning the room after the last person stayed with their dog. For being a hotel of this caliber it seriously makes me question the cleanliness regarding things that are not immediately noticeable. Did they comp us? No. They moved us to a different floor. I think they should comp us a stay at least for the rudeness. Note to Chateau PR, don't post a canned reply saying your sorry. I think hotels should put up or shut up if you actually care. That's the business. When you screw up you drown the customer in freebies to ensure they return again and again. More than half of the hotel was empty. Otherwise it's a beautiful building. This is a nice hotel in an area not none for upscale accommodations. Quite a ways from the action of the strip and the landing. I would choose to avoid the traffic on the strip anyway, but that is necessary evil of Branson because no one in that part of the world has studied civil engineering and infrastructure.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly our favorite hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: JohnL26
Reviews.Content: Always wonderful service in laid back luxury. I always bring the family and we get a suite overlooking the euro-style pool and Table Rock Lake. Sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine listening to jazz music flowing from the pool speakers puts you at ease like nothing else. We go at least once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KsLouise
Reviews.Content: Was always interested in staying here from my first glance from the middle of the lake on a house boat trip at Table Rock. It was indeed all I expected. Staff very nice, beautiful surroundings inside. Would be interested in a stay in the summer to take advantage of the outdoor facilities. Not enough time this trip to take in all the amenities, hopefully another time.

Reviews.Title: “This was a very good choice. Plain and simple: Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Justice4JC
Reviews.Content: First off, I booked my reservation close the beginning of the year for a conference I was going to be in town for. I had procrastinated and didn't get the cheaper room I was aiming for, so I booked it for the next cheapest. About a week or two before I was to fly out to Branson, I called and asked if they had any cheaper rooms available. Come to find out, they did. It was a handicap room but that didn't matter. She told me I would lose my originally-booked lake view but I said that was all right. The lady was very informative, kind, professional, and helpful. I was very impressed with the grounds of the resort. The views are magnificent. Inside the resort is just as impressive. My expectations were surpassed! I had read the previous reviews, but I wasn't prepared for that! From the little river/waterfall in the center of the lobby (with REAL FISH at the bottom) to the glass elevators. It was very nice. They have an indoor AND outdoor pool, a business center with two computers, a HUGE convention/conference area, and more to rave about. After I got settled in, I sent pictures to my family and friends to show them where I was staying. The location of the resort was about 15-20 minutes from the church where my conference was. It was also a shorter distance to the 76 strip which is where a LOT of the attractions, theaters, and restaurants are. I like that the resort wasn't on the strip itself. I like the seclusion. Whoever chose that location deserves much kudos. The room was fantastic as far as cleanliness goes. That's a huge deal to me. The housekeepers are very thorough. They are also very attentive and take the initiative, because I always put a towel down in front of the toilet, and by the third or fourth day, I came back into my room and found a rug there, LOL. It was nice. :-) Service was great. From room service to the bellstaff constantly opening the doors for me, to check-in and check-out. I mainly kept to myself during my stay, but the little interaction I did have was very nice. I work in the hotel industry, so it was nice (and a little weird, lol) being on the receiving end of the treatment. Value for the room was good as were the rooms themselves. I rated each of them four because the value for other things were pricey -- the spa, even the food. And the room didn't have a refrigerator. I worked around that though by filling my icebucket with ice and setting my juice in there, so it worked out. For seven nights, I did spend a pretty penny, but it was all worth it, I feel. I plan to attend the same conference next year around the same time. I'll be looking at Chateau on the Lake again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: letsgo53
Reviews.Content: this is my second trip to Branson, and I was intrigued with the Chateau 4 years ago. We were shuttled from the new airport to pick up our Hertz rental car tfrom the Chateau and the interior is lovely. So we saved a special evening to have dinner in the Restaurant. We were 1 of three tables dining on 9/24/09, so the wait staff were not rushed. I ordered the salom-shrimp with Bernaise sauce. The other dinner was a filet of beef. I was very dissapointed with my meal- the shrimp were over cooked indicated by the rubbery texture, not tender as proberly cooked shrimp are. The Bernaise was without a hint of tarragon, and the salmon was in my opinion overcooked. When the DR manager came over to ask at the midpoint of the dinner how the meal was. I was kind and only expressed my displeasure of the lack of taste of the Bernaise, and he acknowledged that the difference between hollandase/bernaise is the tarragon. He said he would check with the "Chef". I was expecting some reply from him but did not see him. For the price of the meal it DID not set a standard I would expect from this level of restaurant. I could not recommend this restaurant for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: awaitingjamaica
Reviews.Content: Our entire stay was very relaxing and well worth the money. We arrived at the New Branson airport and the Concierge met us there with complimentary transportation to the resort. Check in was easy and we were given a complimentary upgrade. The room was beautiful and large enough for a family of 4-5. We had lunch poolside, dinner at their restaurant and breakfast on the terrace. All of the staff was very accomodating. Food was delicious. In the evening we sat on the terrace and wen tto the Library for drinks. Pool was nice. Spa treatments were nice. Would recommend to anyone who wants a day of relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickyM475
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed our stay..Staff very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping did a wonderful job. I am spoiled by this experience.

Reviews.Title: “You won't get what you pay for !”
Reviews.Author: mkellerman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chateau 3 days in September...our first room overlooked the large propane tanks...the second room one floor higher overlooking same...the 3rd room overlooked the front parking lot. We paid for a Chateau King res #787949 Mr. Stephen Marshall....your staff would not give us a lakefront room to save their lives, even though the Hotel was only half full....this is a lovely Hotel and should be # 1 on tripadvisor, and probably would be if it wern't for the staff lousey handeling of guests. Stephen, sorry but we can't reccomend your Hotel. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: AnyaRL
Reviews.Content: We went for our one year anniversary and had a fabulous time! The resort was stunning and the spa was lovely as well!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Branson”
Reviews.Author: GoSpartans
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perched high on a hill overlooking beautiful Table Rock Lake. The hotel is nicely decorated with an atrium and water fall in the lobby. We had room 230. The room itself was nice. Everything seemed new and clean. The room was average to large in size with two queen beds and a large flat screen television. There was a wet bar area in the room, itself, but it did not include a mini-bar or fridge. The bathroom was large with a huge vanity area. One nice touch was a hamper in the bathroom for wet towels (you didn't have to leave them on the floor or in the tub if you wanted them to be replaced.) Overall, the rooms were comfortable, clean and nice. Our room, unfortunately, had absolutely no view. We had one window that looked out at the roof of the entrance. Seriously, we looked at a steepled roof. We did not complain as we were on business. I'm sure their are rooms with great views, most with sliding doors and small balconies. Just avoid this room if you would like a view. The pool was nice with a great view, and usually not too crowded in the morning. It could get difficult to a chair later in the day. Also, on the ground floor near the pool there was a large patio area with tables and comfortable chairs. There was also a fountain. This was a nice area to sit and relax, read, have a drink, and enjoy the view of the lake and mountains. There was a nice sweets and coffee shop from which you could grab a coffee and muffin or cinnamon rool for breakfast or ice cream of cake for dessert. The prices at this shop were rather reasonable and the servings large. I did eat at the restaurant for breakfast twice, once having the buffet and the other ordering off the menu. I didn't think the buffet was worth the money. Anything at the buffet could be ordered off the menu, and some of the items on the buffet were soggy, etc. The prices were high, but similar to other hotel restaurant prices. It was never busy, and the food was pretty good, but not great. The service was good, although the hostess was not the friendliest. One nice amenity was a small movie theater that showed two movies daily. The first showing at 2 p.m. was always a kids movie, and the second at 7 p.m. was usually PG or PG-13. Popcorn was served. This was a nice diversion on a rainy afternoon. One afternoon, we rented a pontoon boat and tube from the hotel marina. This was by far the highlight of the trip. The rental fee was reasonable ($200 for 4 hrs. plus gas.) The lake is very large and rather pretty. It is also deep. There were several places for everyone to stop and jump off cliffs into the water. Very fun.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ericsrx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chateau in a suite. It was wonderful. Lots for the kids to do. Great food. Nice pool. Very nice decor. I would happily recommend to anyone wanting a high class vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and fun family vacation getaway”
Reviews.Author: Cyclones4
Reviews.Content: The Chateau on the Lake is a beautiful hotel complete with great amenities. We stayed there over the Fourth of July week with extended family and it provided plenty to do for all ages. The staff really stood out above all as they provided excellent service and went above and beyond anticipating our needs whether we were at the pool, the marina, or the movie theater. And the fireworks display on the 4th was phenomenal! The only hesitation I would have for choosing the Chateau for our next trip to Branson is the fact that none of us were aware that pets were allowed to stay in the rooms. And we were assigned rooms on the "pet" floor and were not able to move upon our arrival because our party would have been separated on different floors to accomodate this request. Noise was not the problem as I thought it might have been but rather I was uncomfortable with dogs being walked through the restaurant area and the pool area with small children playing everywhere. Also, I did not like thinking that someone else's pet likely slept on the bed or couch in our room. Aside from the pet issue, I was impressed with the accomodations and would recommend it to anyone desiring an upscale vacation experience - as long as you aren't allergic to pets.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for Branson”
Reviews.Author: climbingduo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort with an amazing staff. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. This is our main criteria on whether we return to a resort or not. We loved our room - a chateau king with an amazing view of the lake. Loved the high speed elevators with the center atrium views. Marina is very well equipped with a pleasant staff. Outdoor pool has nice views . . . they even have lemon-scented cooling towels brought to your chair on the hot days! All of our meals were excellent and reasonably priced for what you get. Loved the Sweet Shoppe. Resort is adjacent to the dam and state park with hiking trail. Highly recommend this resort to those who want an upscale resort in Branson away from "the strip" and on the lake. Only a quick drive to the shows if you do want to go - we used our Garmin which took us on the backroads and got us there quickly. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey”
Reviews.Author: begbie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chateau with my girlfriend for three nights on a visit to Table Rock lake and Branson. Had a room on the 5th floor with a view of the lake. Rooms are very nice and well decorated. Lobby of the hotel is very nice with an indoor waterfall, and very impressed with indoor/outdoor pools. My only disappoinments were at a rate of over $300 a night the hotel does not provide a continental breakfast. Also the balcony of our room had many spider webs on the railing and ceiling. I mentioned this to the front desk on our way out one morning, but it was never cleaned And if you plan on renting a boat of jet ski for the lake, avoid the Chateaus marina. Their rates are about 10% more than State Parks Marina just a few miles down the strreet. Overall I enjoyed my stay here but probably would decide to stay somewhere else on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but only three-star service”
Reviews.Author: BradB_NWA
Reviews.Content: Decided to take my wife to this highly regarded hotel for Mother's Day this year as I wanted to show her a very special time. I selected the hotel's bed and breakfast package which included a one night stay, allegedly overlooking the mountains, and breakfast room service. Well, things didn't turn out as expected. Upon arrival we were met by a downright unpleasant valet who, upon discovering we had no business to extend him, rebuffed us with quite a sneer. Unperturbed, we proceeded to check in only to be met by a nice, but untrained, young lady. After having to assist her to provide us with our own needs we went up to our room which was indeed nice. The beds we luxurious (my thoughts), if a bit hard (my wife's comments.) The view was of the lake, if one were to stay far from the window. Otherwise it was of the trash bin and back of the hotel where, to our chagrin, we learned we would be treated to a frequent host of banging noises. Still, we enjoyed the room overall. We eventually wandered out of our room and ended up at the sweet shop for dessert. What a disappointment that was. Again, service was not only lacking but the selection of available food items was scant, at best. Nevertheless, the view from the shop was magnificent and we thoroughly enjoyed our treats. Soon after, we visited the gift shop where a perfectly lovely lady, the shop manager, conversed with us as if we were old friends. After selecting many fine gifts to take home with us we sauntered on to enjoy a dinner on the town. Here again, service was an issue for when we asked for directions into town from the hotel we were misdirected. The evening went uneventfully but we didn't sleep comfortably. The next morning, upon waking, we ordered breakfast via room service. It was not a difficult order but it took the staff three trips and an argument with my wife to get our order complete. Even so, the food was lukewarm, at best, and nearly inedible. The coffee, however, was great and we highly recommend it. Good luck if you decide to stay here but we do not feel comfortable recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “On the Verge of Greatness”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBen
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Chateau, but the first in several years. We used to come annually to meet friends at an conference and came because this is where the conference was booked. We always liked the location (love Table Rock Lake and the surrounding Ozark scenery), and the hotel offers alot of amenities that are otherwise almost impossible to find in Branson. As such, when we were thinking of coming back to Table Rock, we wanted to stay here. Unfortunately, despite the millions of dollars spent on the place, the resort can't seem to entirely shake the dust of the Branson strip from its feet. In my opinion, this place needs to decide relatively quickly whether it wants to be a top notch resort catering to those seeking R & R in the beautiful Ozark scenery or just another Branson tourist trap. With proper management and just a few slight adjustments, it could easily be the former. Unfortunately, I'm afraid that too many guests today are leaving with the impression that it is the latter. A couple of specific suggestions: (1) Charging $10 a day for internet access is just beneath the standards of a 4 star resort - even the motels on the strip advertise "Free Wi-Fi." Either add $10 to the room price or put a quarter machine at the side of each bed where the guest can choose between internet access or a 10 minute massage bed. This goes for the many additional "charges" we encountered - $2.50 for a band-aid to cover our son's stubbed toe at the pool was another particularly egregious example - if you want to be a 4 star resort, act like it. If you just want to pick your guests' pocket at every turn, then rename yourself the "Baldknobbers" or some such thing and move to Hwy 76; (2) The service has got to be more consistent. This was our #1 complaint from our prior stays. However, I must say that during our first night, I was VERY pleasantly surprised. The wait staff at the main dining room for Friday night dinner was superb, as were the girls at the twilight "S'mores" campfire for the kids and the very friendly (and prompt) waiter we had for Saturday morning breakfast. Unfortunately, it was all down-hill from there. Our service (including the front desk staff, concierge, and waitstaff in the restaurants) for the next 2 days were terribly slow and unfriendly. On the positive side, however, the outdoor pool, marina, tennis courts and activities staff are great. We loved the "Sweet Shoppe" and other on-site amenitites. The bottom line is that I REALLY like this place and want to see it succeed as a first rate destination resort in the beautiful Ozark Mountains. I love the facilities, the marina, the scenery and the idea. Unfortunately, it's the little things that are getting in the way right now. We will keep trying it out from time to time and I am really hoping to be able to eventually give it my whole-hearted recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service! Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeag96
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 18-month old and 2-month old son, stayed at Chateau on the Lake for my parents' 50th anniversary, along with 19 other members of our family. Our room was beautifully kept, and very neatly appointed. I cannot say enough about the housekeeping, bell staff, and concierge and front desk personnel. They were all very nice to us and very helpful throughout our stay as we struggled to keep up with our sons. Every need we had was met by the wonderful staff. We enjoyed the Memorial weekend barbecue and beautiful fireworks show. I cannot say enough about what a memorable experience they made it for us and our parents and family for their anniversary. We also thought it was a nice, out of the way location, if you want to get away from all of the hustle and bustle of Branson. The only thing that was a bit much were the food prices in the hotel restaurants. Plenty of other options in Branson though to keep you happy. Overall a great stay and we'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Paramount!”
Reviews.Author: lsutigers1
Reviews.Content: Ever since I was a child I have always looked forward to going to my favorite hotel, Chateau on The Lake. This hotel is very up-to-date and has a theatre, pool(indoors and out), gym, spa, and breathtaking view of the gorgeous lake. In side the hotel is a breath taking waterfall that has thrilled me since a child. The rooms are great but the rates are a tid bit high in my opinion. The food is great. There are several conference rooms and a few gift shops as well. I would recommend this hotel to families with young children or even a couple that just wants to relax. Chateau is absoloutely paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but a bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: kkzswtdrm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was breathtaking on the way up the hill, but fell somewhat short after that. The hotel was very pretty inside but lacked anything spectacular to explain the high cost. The indoor pool was average. The room was nice but the bed was terrible. The view from the room's balcony is very pretty if you are lucky enough to get lakeside. The food was good but very very overpriced. Room service food was bearable and very expensive (i.e. one cheeseburger (A),one chicken sandwich (A) and one brownie from the kids menu--no drinks=$43.00). There is a charge for internet in the room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, but the service is lacking...”
Reviews.Author: jmaynard79
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very beautiful, and the views are top notch, but for the cost of our 2 night stay, (over 1k including a meal), the service and the food were not up to par. It felt like the hotel was running on a skeleton crew. When we 1st arrived I asked the valet and the front desk where I could buy some wine to celebrate my wife's birthday, I was told by both of them to go to a gas station. That didn't make alot of sense to me, I also asked where I could get a good meal, and instead of informing that there was a restaurant in the hotel, they suggested some place down the road. It wasn't until going to the Library Lounge that I actually got some decent service. The bartender was very helpful and informed me that they have a large wine selection right there at the hotel and he found the bottle I was looking for. Very nice guy, as for the rest of the staff, they made it feel more like we went to a Ramada... there wasn't even anyone to open the doors when you walk in. Not a big deal in a cheap motel but when I'm paying over 1k for a couple night stay and a meal, I expect better service. As for the fine dining... well, again, the view is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay...as always”
Reviews.Author: arkieranger
Reviews.Content: We're beginning to call the Chateau on the Lake our second home when we travel to Branson. We aren't world travelers but take vacations across the US twice a year and the Chateau always ranks at the top of our list. We had a credit card issue when we checked in due to our local bank implenting some new security features last week on debit/credit cards due to some type of security breach on their system and we found out (the hard way) that until they get the kinks out, the card will not work outside our home state (Arkansas). Fortunately we carried enough cash for the trip so the trip was not adversely affected but the staff of the Chateau was VERY understanding and worked with us to allow a smooth stay despite the card issues. We cannot say enough about the staff --- VERY professional and helpful As always, our daughter's favorite spots were the swimming pool and pastry shop. We brought our laptop along on the trip and was a little surprised to find an extra fee ($9.95 per day) for internet access. I would like to see the Chateau build this fee into the room package down the road if possible. We use trip advisor a alot during our trips and the laptop really helped. Overall, as always, we would (and do) highly recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Is this 2009?”
Reviews.Author: JHat10
Reviews.Content: It never dawned on me to check to see if a hotel in 2009 actually had FREE internet access (for an 'additional charge' you can get on the internet on ONE computer) At $200+ a night, one would think that a modern amenity such as internet/wi-fi would be included, but alas, the Chateau seems to be either stuck in 2004 or has adopted the attitude of "if you can afford $220/night for a room, what is another $10/day. Don't get me wrong...BEAUTIFUL hotel, but for crying out loud....quit nickle-and-diming me. Won't stay there again. Internet access is free at the cheaper hotels and how nice the room REALLY need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mttee
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to go to Branson for our annual Christmas shopping trip. I discovered we could stay here for around the same price as the regular 3 star hotels where we usually stay and for quite a bit less than a couple of the other nice hotels in the area. The staff was friendly and welcoming. And when we arrived we received a complimentary upgrade which was great. The hotel and grounds were beautiful. The inside was beautiful as well with a huge atrium complete with waterfall and lovely plants. And it was decorated for Christmas with lots of lights and an incredible gingerbread house. The room was great - nicely decorated and extremely clean. The beds were comfortable with lots of pillows. The bathroom was very nice - nice tile and granite countertops. The hotel has a great pool/spa area with indoor and outdoor pools and also it's own movie theater which shows free movies in the evening. I liked the fact that the indoor pool and hot tub area are open for 24 hours. We spent the evening in the library lounge which was very nice with a big fireplace and lots of cozy seating. Drinks were expensive but good and there was a guitar player and singer who were very entertaining. They offer appetizer type food here and we ordered the ravioli which was good. We also ordered the "deconstructed bruschetta" which was the only dark spot on the entire stay. There's just no sugarcoating the awfulness of it - especially the salmon/cheese mixture which was fishy and horrible. BUT - still a good evening and atmosphere. Our stay wasn't long enough to enjoy all the wonderful amenities this hotel offers. We really hope to be able to return for a longer stay and I especially would like to visit the spa. I would definitely recommend this hotel and think it was a great value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: TNTAllen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Chateau. It was our first getaway without our 2 children and it was just what we needed! We came home relaxed and refreshed. The staff is wonderful. Very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded to a larger room upon check in. A pleasant surprise. The decor was warm and inviting. We were there just in time to enjoy the Christmas decorations. The room was a very good size (deluxe king) and comfortable. There were two vanity areas one in the bathroom and one in the bedroom area. Very helpful for two people getting ready to go out. The balcony with views of Table Rock Lake was also nice. It was a little chilly on our visit, but in warmer weather it would be wonderful to have breakfast on the balcony. Indoor Pool/Whirlpool area was very nice. Adults only after 10 pm was especially great. There were more children at the resort than I expected for such an upscale resort. A little noise on our floor one night around midnight-1:00 am. The only meals we had at the hotel were breakfast. The package we booked came with in-room breakfast (or you can elect a $35 breakfast credit in the restaurant which was nice for some variety). The food was excellent and plentiful! The restaurant offered a full breakfast buffet on the Sunday morning we went down to the restaurant. I have to say, the best part of the resort is the spa!!! I enjoyed a Chateau signature massage which allowed access to full use of the spa facilities including an outdoor whirlpool, indoor whirlpool, eucalyptus steam room, dry sauna and relaxation lounge with snacks and beverages. My husband came along and enjoyed the facilities for only an additional $20. This was a very memorable weekend for us. We will absolutely return to this hotel next time we have a chance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Chateau was Great the Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: mlr
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I just returned from another great little get-away to Branson. It was our second stay at the Chateau and this visit was just as nice as our first - the weather even cooperated this time. Last time it snowed :0) We purchased a hotel/show package directly through the hotel and we were not disappointed. We saw Tony Roi (Elvis impersonator - Elvis is 'alive and well' in Branson!) The room was perfect - clean, roomy with a very comfy bed - and the Sunday Champaign Brunch was all we remembered. Anything your little heart could desire - the omelets were perfection. Service top notch. We will visit again - you can be sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: julieyMissouri
Reviews.Content: Wow this place is wonderful, very clean and friendly staff. I like the fact that they offer a lot of fun things to do for children and young families, They had a "dive in" night where they played a family movie by the pool. The kids can play in the pool and watch a movie what a blast! The kids loved getting milk and cookies delivered by a teddy bear to our room before bedtime. This is a high end hotel and your service is just that nothing but the best!

Reviews.Title: “If you have to be in Bransom...”
Reviews.Author: mandlintx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chateau with my family during a conference. The Chateau is very high end, but not stuffy. Far away from the strip - thank God! The Chateu is also VERY kid-friendly, they have two pools, a playground, movie theater, ect. Food and drinks are very expensive - think $8 for a beer by the pool - gratuity automatically added on!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamjeanne
Reviews.Content: I would like to respond to some of the past poor reviews. We stayed here for a class reunion and everyone on the staff was great.. The pool was wonderful with ice towels and water served whenever needed. This is an upscale hotel and as such it doesn't have the conveniences lower class hotels have. At the Ritz you don't even get a coffee maker. If you want a microwave and fridge stay at the comfor inn. Our experience was great and we had a lovely view of the lake. Really enjoyed our stay, just not long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Considering Chateu”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Tulsa
Reviews.Content: I'm really stunned by all of the negative posts about this hotel. I was thinking about getting away for a weekend with my wife and staying here, it looks so nice from the outside. It seems that maybe Chateau is looking beyond the simple things that people like the most. Things like courtesy, rooms with ammenities that the other hotels offer, etc. And they don't offer a free breakfast for guests? Unbelievable. If I had to book a room today knowing what I do from this message board, I'd have to pass on Chateau. It looks like somebody really dropped the ball with this hotel. It's obvious they're reading these posts, and they have some work to do.

Reviews.Title: “Suzuavenue”
Reviews.Author: Suzuavenue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chateau while he was attending a meeting there. I found the staff to be very friendly, helpful, and courteous to us during our stay. The room was always clean and neat. The food was excellent at the Grille; the staff there was very friendly and good at making suggestions and open to alternatives to the meal selected. The Spa staff was fabulous to me. Kari and Cheka were great with their spa services they provided. Linda was great as a receptionist there. She was very helpful in showing me around the spa area. The Atrium is beautiful, with all of it's waterfalls, fish, and birds there. Very peaceful! The hotel is kid-friendly as well. There is an outdoor playground for the children to use, activities coordinated by the staff, a movie theater, and game room. All seem to be very well managed. All in all, I would say our experience there was top-notch! I would recommend anyone considering this hotel to give it a try, even for a weekend. You will not be disappointed. We definately will return there, hopefully soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “relaxation for free”
Reviews.Author: dori06
Reviews.Content: I stay here because my husband's company puts us up here. It's beautiful and I do love it. We come during the slowest part of the year which is nice for us. The beds are some of the best out there. I always rest very well. As far as the rest...there is no microwave, no refrigerator. That, to me, is crazy. Who doesn't offer that? We've not encountered a bad stay but it's never been exceptional either. In all, for the price of what one would pay for this room, the customer service should be beyond expectation. Okay, I do get the front door opened for me, he does say "your welcome" when I say "thank you" but he doesn't look really happy and when I went into the second entry doors with my rolling suitcase, I was left to struggle alone. When I arrived a day later than my husband and went to pick up my key. Again, not so happy to assist me. Overall, if you want a beautiful hotel with a breathtaking view, this is your place. If you want someone to kiss tail it's not happening. Go here to enjoy a great place. With that being said, if I had to pay for my room I would probably have a different opinion of the necessity to at least be somewhat respectful of the patronage especially during a slower period of Branson, which is world know for being a hotspot and should be able to handle anytime of the year with equality

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Firemandavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau July 27th and 28th with Two adults and three boys aged 8,6, and 5 and found it to be an extremely nice and impressive looking property. The lobby and grounds were beautiful as were the surrounding views. Service was friendly and accommodating and the hotel had a resort feel to it. The pools were child friendly and family oriented and the on site little movie theatre and child care/play programs were nice perks. All that being said, the ultimate experience was tempered by the costs involved. The room we had was a deluxe non-smoking with two full beds. The room was equivalent in size to a mid-level room at the Hampton Inn but honestly not as nice. We stayed at a Hampton Inn near Ft. Smith, AR the night before arriving at the Chateau and had a much nicer experience. The Hampton Inn had a refrigerator and microwave, plush queen size beds, large comfortable sitting chair, and a free well stocked breakfast including hot foods. The Chateau had none of these things. The Chateau has three restaurants, a lounge, and a ice cream/bakery. ALL OF THEM are high priced with the cheapest items in the restaurants around $14.00 but most much higher. There are no restaurants or grocery stores close to the hotel which forces you to spend more at the hotel. While beautiful and probably the nicest Branson has to offer, the Chateau is a poor value for families unless money is no object. SDC Package: Our two nights with two day SDC passes and $50 food credit came to $680.00.

Reviews.Title: “July 4th seemed more than the staff could handle”
Reviews.Author: preciouspuppies
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Chateau on the Lake numerous times and have always been very happy. Our first problem was in our shower was large amounts of long black hair. We called to ask housekeeping if they could do a cleaning on the shower. Never. Next day was same hair. Not even disturbed. Our son LOVES Crawdaddies kids club. He had a great experience. We spent our evening at the pool. Normally a waiter gives lots of attention to those spending money. You practically had to beg them to to come by. They guy next to us even asked him why he didn't come to our side of the pool since we were all ordering drinks. A gratuity is included. Period. Very poor service. Third day. We returned to our room at 2-2:30 to relax. Our room was not touched. On our second call to the front desk said it would be 15 minutes. No problem. that came and went. I went out to the hallway to find a housekeeper. I was very willing to make it up myself since my son was sleeping on the couch. I found the supervisor. She had NEVER received a message from the front desk. It was all on her paper in black & white. So the front desk NEEDLESSLY lied about our servive. The supervisor helped me make up the room. I did the bathroom. She was a sweetheart. Is this how a 4 star hotels run???? We paid $300 a night for this "service". We were charged for handicapped valet parking. The fireworks were held on the 5th instead of the 4th. I am sure there was a good reason. The fireworks themselves are BREATHTAKING. What was horrible was the rudeness of the guests driving in and out while this is happening. Leaving car lights on. Very distracting. They did have a person trying to handle all this but one person couldn't begin to make this work. The area should be blocked off to every thing but emergency vehicles. If you aren't there on time. Wait or walk in. Check out was a nightmare. The staff was very over worked and very rude. We will return but only based on previous visits. Based on this visit they should lose a star or two. Make your own room up? Not even at the Motel 8. Please expect to pay dearly for any extras. Great location. A little out of the way if you plan to make numerous trips into Branson, They have been outstanding in the past and I hope that they can work out these problems. I think the housekeeping and the rudeness of the staff was just too much.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to the Chateau a third is in our future.”
Reviews.Author: TravelHappyFam
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Chateau. We really enjoy our time here. We stay in an ambassador lake suite. It has a seperate king bedroom and a living area with a pull out sofa. This is nice as we have one child and it is nice to have the seperate areas. The bedroom had a balcony overlooking the lake- very nice. The living room had a railing type balcony (can't go out on it) that overlooked the lake as well. The beds are very comfortable and everything was nice and clean. The indoor and outdoor pools were heated very comfortably. The grounds are meticulously landscaped as are the array of plants in the hotel itself. We did not use the spa but did go in to look at the beautiful chandelier/waterfall. We did use the marina and rented jetskis which were a blast. The lake was very empty and it was fun to zip around. The restaurants are also nice. One warning for the atrium cafe-don't order the steak salad, it is $16 which would imply it is a large dinner salad, but it is actually the size of a side salad containing only lettuce and a very small portion of steak. The shrimp salad is a much better value. On the positive side, when I complained about my salad we were offered dessert complimentary. The fine dining is really good!!! They even make their own mozzarella (not an easy feat). The deli makes a mean sandwich as well. However, the food does not come cheap so be prepared for the bill. We thought it was worth it and ate most lunches and dinners on site. The staff remembers your name and asks you how you are when they see you. Very friendly staff members all around. We really felt welcomed. The only other comment to add is that during our stay there was a very bad thunderstorm. This caused the fire alarms to go off before 4am. Then they went off again after 4am. I felt the staff handled the situation very well and the manager took half the room rate for the inconvenience. I don't think we could have asked for the situation to be handled any better!! Overall, we really enjoy this resort and will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Armyoline68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a Sunday-Wed trip. The resort is top notch. We ate in both restaurants in the resort and the are both worth the expensive price tag. We would both recommend the pork chops. They recently got a new head chef and it shows. At the resort we stayed in a normal room for most nights and then the resort upgraded us to a top level suite on the last night due to a leak in our first room. I'm not sure how much more the suite was but I wouldn't pay it unless you have a larger group there with you or you just need the space. The suite did come with a bar and a fridge. Both rooms had balconies over looking the lake which is a must! The pool was nice and had a bartender on call. The spa was great, but like other aspects it was unreal expensive for what you get! Overall the resort is great considering how cheesy Branson is. If you have the money stay here. If you are looking to save some money...think otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: izzafoodie
Reviews.Content: When we pick up our daughter from a nearby camp we always stay at the Chateau and get a special room service dinner. The beds are so comfortable and we enjoy the room service very much.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveler6
Reviews.Content: Stayed in April 08 for a buss convention and extended the stay for a day for leisure. Very nice property with a nice staff. We were greeted by most everyone as we walked through the property. Overall the hotel has a nice Embassy Suites type feel to it in its design. (Sans the free morning breakfast) The room was standard, nothing too fancy but clean and with nice furnishings. We stayed on the 10th floor which had a nice view of the lake and surrounding area. Our travel companions were on lower floors and had nice views of rooftop air conditioners. The room had a standard bathroom and outside an additional vanity area with sink. There was a coffee maker but no fridge in the room. As other reviews stated, the hotel's public areas are all very nice, well maintained and inviting. The hotel has a nice (and apparently newer) bar area which had a great bartender. The only downside is it is Branson and the bar closed down early each. (11pm-ish) We had a nice convention rate of $130 a night which I feel was a good value for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SheckyFromLawrence
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chateau for a conference in early March. I'm not a big Branson fan, but I would go back to stay at this hotel again. I can't see enough about the staff. They were courteous, accomodating, and always had smiles. The Spa was wonderful as well. I had two treatments and both were delightful. This was the best conference hotel I've been to in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Destination”
Reviews.Author: 222racer
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just returned from a 7 night stay at the Chateau on the Lake in Branson, MO. We booked the Vice Presidential Suite and one connecting room with 2 doubles overlooking the lake. Although the cool weather did not permit enjoying it, both the suite and the room had a small balcony with 2 chairs. The VP suite also had a one-person jetted tub. On the first day I spent 8 wonderful hours in the Spa Chateau. The massage therapist, Jodi, was wonderful. My only complaint is that I was not offered a lunch and having only had a cup of coffee before my services was famished by 5 PM! They kept directing me to their "snacks" which consisted of a few grapes, whole apples and dried fruit that could not be identified. Also, there was water, but no juice offerings. I got the idea that the spa was not very well managed. Use of the laundry services (2 washers and 2 dryers on the 10th floor) is free, with charges only for the soap and softener. We purchased our own at the Walgreens just down the hill and kept up with our laundry... less to do when you get home. The Chateau Grille is the restaurant in the hotel and the food is very good. Service is friendly, but we opted for room service after twice waiting nearly 30 minutes to receive the check after finishing our meal. The hotel is very quiet, but the indoor pool was very crowded each time we tried to use it. The Sweet Shoppe had wonderful ice cream and coffee and stayed open until 11PM! The hotel is just a short drive to the Branson strip, and there are many dining choices on the way. On our last day we stopped in Danna's Barbecue and Burgers for a late lunch (a sign outside boasted "The best burgers in Branson!")... Although my husband opted for the catfish plate, I got the single cheeseburger and onion rings and was not disappointed. This is also the ONLY place that offered freshly brewed SWEET TEA!!! I think if we return to Branson I'll stop in there first and buy a gallon to keep at our hotel! As for the shows: We went to the Dixie Stampede and were very entertained. Just be cautious where you purchase your tickets, and be aware that if you purchase them and receive "vouchers" you will have to stand in line to pick up the actual tickets before being admitted. The show lasted 3 whole hours... beware if you have little ones with early bedtimes or short attention spans! All in all we had a very relaxing stay and would probably return to the hotel on a future visit. (Especially in the warmer seasons to enjoy the lake activities.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Time”
Reviews.Author: KC2833
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from the Chateau on March 17th. We had booked the Girlfriends Spa Weekend. It was an absolute fabulous time. This is the second year we have done this and will continue to do it in the future. We arrived on Saturday and our room was ready and very nice. Our wine and fruit was delivered right to our room. Everyone there was extremely nice and helpful. The spa is the best spa I have ever been in. Very relaxing and peaceful. We spent 6 hours there on Sunday getting our facial, pedicare and massage and using the other things like the sauna, pool, etc. We ate their breakfast buffet on Sunday morning. It was $13, but we got our money's worth. Very good selection. The omelets are wonderfull! We love the Chatea for it's location outside of the hustle and bustle of Branson. We got to enjoy shopping and eating in Branson, but could then come back to the quiet of the lake. All in all was a great girls weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “New years stay”
Reviews.Author: behjp
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation on Chateau on the lake.com. I reserved the Ambassador Suite and thought I was getting a nice room. When I arrived at the hotel the inside was beautiful. It was decorated very nice for the holidays. When we recived our room we went right up and opened the door and was quite dissapointed. The furniture was beat up pretty bad, it was a very average room for the price of 289 that we paid. the robes were dirty hangin in the closet, as soon as I used the restroom it clogged the first time, the phone is 8.50 a min for a local or long distance call, our champange and special things were not there and we had to go down stairs and get them, they didnt even let us know details about the new years eve party that we were going to. Overall I was very diappointed in this hotel.. If you are between the ages of 27-30 this hotel is not for you. It is a very older crowd and not very youthfull. I will go back to the spa but I would not stay in this hotel again or go to the new years eve party again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: DivaSarah
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 month son, & I stayed at the resort in September 2007. We loved it! We had requested a crib when booking and it was waiting in our room upon arrival along with a cute Chateau teddy bear for our son. The staff was wonderful and friendly. We enjoyed some sweets from their sweet shop though the soda pop was expensive. We ended up getting drinks in town most of the time. My parents booked our room along with theirs and they requested a room on a high floor. The staff member ended up giving us a free upgrade to a deluxe room. We loved the rooms! They were very spacious and had great views of the lake and pool. They include an extra vanity in the room which made getting ready easier. I can't say how much we enjoyed our stay here. We did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Branson”
Reviews.Author: tetons4two
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Chateau on the Lake for the first time because they have a pet friendly policy. We have now decided that we would stay there with or without our pet. Everything from check in to extending our stay by one day was completed by a very professional and friendly staff. They truly mean that they are a pet friendly hotel as they had a special area to walk the dog and provided materials to clean up after our pet. The staff was always very quick to respond to any requests. The hotel was spotless and was perfectly decorated for Christmas. When we checked in they even had a children's choir singing. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants but we overheard people saying how great the food was so we will make the effort to try one of the restaurants in the future. I just can't say enough nice things about the Chateau on the Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice if you can afford it.”
Reviews.Author: rosst11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my wedding night. It was very elegant. And we sure did pay for it. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was very nice with a view of Table Rock Lack which was nice. We ordered a pizza late at night using room service. It cost us $25!!! That's a lot to me. My only real complaint was that I could hear people in the hall talking very clearly, I would expect such a pricey place to have better sound proofing.

Reviews.Title: “Need more for your money.”
Reviews.Author: misse36
Reviews.Content: We came to this Hotel after staying at the Gaylord in Nashville. The hotel was very nice , clean and the staff was very friendly. Our first problem was our room was overlooking the roof with lighs ,vents, fans etc... When we complained we were moved to another room with no problem or trouble. We thought the Hotel was great except fpr the price of the room which was 179.00 a nite and included nothing compaired to the Gaylord which was very compatible in price. The Gaylord had free bottled water, intertnet (The Chateau's internet was 10.00 a day extra)and shuttle to events the Chateau had none of this.If you do not have a car travel is very inconvient and there is nothing around there that is walking distance .All of the other Hotels are at least in walking distance. Deb

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort but Away from the Action”
Reviews.Author: JH_all7s
Reviews.Content: The Chateau on the Lake is a very pretty, almost majestic hotel. It sits atop a peak overlooking a nearby lake. The common areas are very nice as are the rooms. In general, the entire property is very well maintained. The upscale restaurant in the hotel serves good food although the service is a bit rough. Most of the restaurant staff is made up of foreigners who speak limited english and seem to be a little inexperienced in food service etiquette. Though most seem to have good attitudes. The on-site spa is okay. My wife had a massage that she said was "fine, but nothing special." The one thing that guests of the hotel should be aware of is it's distance to the shows, shops and activities in Branson. Fortunately we had a rental car, but we had to drive a minimum of 20 mins. to get to anything worthwhile in the city. Some attractions were over 30 mins. This is okay but there were days when we were going back and forth between shopping in the afternoon and dinners and shows in the evenings. This requires quite a bit of time in the car. Overall we had a nice stay but would probably review some in-town options next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hotelio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible right form the start. The staff (with the exception of the bell staff) is comprised of zombie like people who seem to detest their jobs and people in general. The hotel is dark and depressing and the rooms are dated. Our duvet had a 'personal ' stain on it and housekeeping was downright beligerent when we asked for a new one.We were supposed to stay 2 nights but decided to check out after one night. After notifying the front desk that we would be leaving in the morning the manager insisted that we pay for 2 nights anyway. We refused and he finally backed down. We checked into the Hilton Promenade at Branson Landing and it was very nice and a bit less expensive. AVOID THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Not all we had hoped”
Reviews.Author: auntcarla
Reviews.Content: our room was directly above the dumpster and the smell was terrible. Could not enjoy having the sliding door open. The "mountian view"was of a construction site. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “almost beyond the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: touren44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau mid July for four nights. Intially we got of to a not so good start as the first room allocated didn't really have a view of Table Lake despite labouring this request during the booking via a long distance phone call from Ireland. But I will say that once we made our dissatisfaction known this was resolved very quickly by the allocation of another room over looking the lake and pool area, hence the above average rating otherwise it would have been an excellent. Having booked the "Chateau King" the room was excellent with the extras that you would expect. The facilites at the resort are excellent including the pool area and the nearby water sport marina. Despite the hotel hosting a boat show convention the pool area was always available with beds and towels and the standard of service very good including the good nature of the valet parking guy's which I would recommend as its undercover parking. This was our first time to the "ozarks" and if you haven't been to Branson and the surrounding countryside thouroughly recommend that you do. I would certainly recommend the Chateau Hotel and intend to return when we can.

Reviews.Title: “cold staff”
Reviews.Author: robinkay
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a four night stay at Chateau on the Lake, and I must say that we were a bit disappointed with how unfriendly the hotel staff was. The bell men were rather friendly when we first arrived, but would not acknowledge guests as they were leaving and returning to the hotel. The lady at the "check in" desk was not very comfortable with her job on the computer and had to ask for supervisor's assistance. We were offered no information on hotel activities for the week, nor were we offered a map of the resort. We had to figure this out on our own. The staff in the Sweet Shoppe were quite unfriendly; they made us feel like we were burdening them by us being there to purchase ice cream. One of our children did have a nice time at Crawdaddies , a kids' program. She was one of the only employees that put forth any effort to be hospitable. We had much higher expectations from the staff with the amount of money that we paid to the resort. We have received much better treatment from three star hotels. I do believe that Chateau's staff would greatly benefit from hospitality training.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: Very nice entrance to the hotel. The walls were paper thin. I could here word for word our neighbors conversations. The food at the deli and hotel restaurant were both not very good. The sweet shop did have EXCELLENT ice cream. The pool was nice and warm and had a pretty view of the lake. The hair all over the bathroom from the previous guest was not appealing. The valets were very nice. I did get a massage at the spa and it was good too until I went to pay and there was an automatic 20% gratuity added that I was not forewarned about. Overall there are plenty of hotels in Branson for a fraction of the cost. I have stayed at 5 star hotels (Plaza Hotel NY; The Waldorf Astoria NY; etc.) and this is nowhere near a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Small Beds”
Reviews.Author: dillonh
Reviews.Content: My sister and I along with my two daughters, 12 and 14 recently stayed at Chateau on the Lake. The resort is fabulous. I have stayed in many upscale hotels/resorts, but no where have I stayed where every employee was not only friendly, but helpful in any way they could be. They served ice water at the pool along with iced wash cloths. The room was beautifully furnished, but the decor was overshadowed by the small beds. The room is described as a deluxe double, which meant the room was slightly larger than a standard double. I wished they had put a regular sized double bed(s) in the room instead of the extra floor space. The bed was so noticibly small, that I measured the bed. It was approximately 52.5 inches in width. A regular double bed is 60 inches in width. We slept two to a bed. The first night, my daughter ended up on the floor. I would stay here again if I could stay in a different type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a perfect experience..,”
Reviews.Author: SHELOVESTRAVELING
Reviews.Content: My fiance, sister and niece met here. It was a beautiful family experience and my fiance took full use of the attached marina with his boat and loved the convenience. I took full advantage of the glamorous spa! It was even nicer than Elemis in Las Vegas! The staff was wonderful and accomodating, they went the extra mile in every way. Tim gave me 2 of the best massages I have ever received. We made this trip for Memorial day and because we wanted an in person look since I am contemplating a small wedding there over Labor Day. That was the only downside. As soon as I mentioned "'small" the wedding coordinator handed me a packet, and blew me off. We stayed 4 nights, and I spent around $1,000.00 for many great services at the spa, not to mention the marina and meal charges and the coordinator didn't even ask my name. I love the facility but am now having to rethink the wedding there.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: JenKansas
Reviews.Content: The resort is nice but for the price you have to pay for your room is not so nice. You are paying for the lobby. But you don't sleep in the lobby. The rooms are a basic hotel room. If you pay the amount that they charge for their rooms you would think it would come with a Jacuzzi tub. Also the rooms are very noisy. You can hear everything. It seems to me they put all their money into the building and lobby. They should have saved some for the rooms. If you would like something romantic I would not recommend this Hotel for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Chateau!”
Reviews.Author: family0f3
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Chateau! This hotel seems to have perfected being a "family friendly" hotel without looking trashy and taking away from the experience for the adults in the group. Not only were the rooms wonderful, the bed comfortable, and the view amazing ... but there was so much to do with the kids it was great! We had 4 adults on the trip, and 4 kids ranging from 3 to 13 years old, and everyone found something to do to their liking. We took paddle boats and canoes out on the lake (free of charge), swam in the indoor pool, played tennis, fished off the docks, and the little ones even enjoyed some cartoons in the movie theater and some time on the playground. I would recommend eating else where. We had one meal at the "Grill" and wasn't too impressed. They had a very limited menu and the prices were a bit high. But other than that our stay was PERFECT! We plan on making return trips!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Travel_and_Learn_07
Reviews.Content: They did not have our room ready at 4 pm and we got upgraded to a lake view. The hotel location and surroundins are very nice and near the major Branson attractions. Lots of things for the kids to do with indoor/outdoor pools, playground and even a movie theater. They had cookies and milk in the afternoon and our kids just loved it!! The atrium is beautiful and the food options and quality were very good. This is a good place to stay while visiting Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Boodogplayer
Reviews.Content: Wow great job you guys. We had a wonderful time. The views, food, and service ALL Great.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, very rude hotel manager and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: comedinewithus
Reviews.Content: Took family to Chateau for the 4th and a birthday, booked several rooms. Our group consisted of adults and children. Went poolside to prepare for the fireworks during the preperation they offered a bbq buffet, the adults in our group were not interested we were going out later to celebrate a 40th birthday, however the children were so we purchased buffets for them. As the children were utalizing the buffet they were asked to leave advised that they need an adult, that was fine so we went through with them, with doing this we were then advised we had to purchase a buffet to be in that area. We tried to explain our situation we were utalizing the outside bar for cocktails but would be dining elsewhere later that evening. Then then told us " Look you either purchase a buffet or GET OUT " so with that we asked to get our monies back they had no problem giving that back. However it does not take from the embaressment from being approached in front of all of the other guests at the hotel, not to mention the kiddos were starving. So we ordered them pizza poolside...This situation pretty much put a damper on the rest of the evening, but I figured I would bring the situation to the attention of the hotel manager "Steven" . As we were preparing to leave we went to the desk to check out and saw we were Charged for the buffets not only for the children but also for all of us adults! UNBELIEVABLE! I asked to speak with Steven and he told me fine I will credit those but you are on the hotels black list and were not welcome back. I own an upscale restaurant we chose the chateau because we wanted a nice getaway for the family, yes this is a more pricey hotel but we did not care we dont mind spending money for nice rooms and good food. However this hotel was very unprofessional in the way they handled the situation. If they thought for one minute we needed to sneak buffets they are wrong, if that was the case we surely would not have stayed at the chateau! Thanks Steven, I intend on letting everyone know just what type of hotel you run. For all of you wanting somewhere nice to stay, look elsewhere there are lots of Great Places in Branson!

HotelInfo.Name: Chateau on the Lake Resort & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 415 N State Hwy 265, Branson, MO 65616
